I have 3 HDMI devices so I purchased an inexpensive Kinivo 501BN Premium 5 port High speed HDMI switch with IR wireless remote to switch between devices  This works well, is expandable and I use just one HDMI port now on the TV.  The picture is not quite as good as Samsung and there are not as many options for 1080i.  However, the differences are minor, 1080i looks beautiful on the Panasonic TV and it is not worth spending hundreds of dollars more.I highly recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: Plasma tv is a pleasure to watch.
Reviews.Author: Emanuele E. Nordone "Manny"
Reviews.Content: Outstanding picture but sound needs to be supported by a soundbar to boust the sound.  The 50 inch screen is clean and bright.  Would definitely recommend it to someone who is in the market for a excellent television with a fair price. The remote covers all bases and covers the needs of the tv.  Would purchase it again.  Love the plasma.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and awesome price!
Reviews.Author: Amazoniac
Reviews.Content: Like the title says the picture looks great and the price was awesome! ive tried it out with my HD movies and games and so far its been impressive. Cant wait to try out with Blu-ray. Ive only had it a short while so I cant really say too much more than the menus are very easy to navigate, set up was a breeze, and getting this on my base was easy! its very light weight and thin! The only thing I did not like was the amazon insta-video app. It was quite sluggish and did not like the User interface. I just use my amazon insta-video app on my ps3. Also the youtube app sucks, it was also sluggish and the user interface wasn't very good either. Did not try the other apps. I will update my review over time to let you guys know how its held up!

Reviews.Title: Great value plasma tv
Reviews.Author: Paula L.
Reviews.Content: Please note:  The four star rating is only for the product and does not include the enhance delivery.This tv is a great value if you don't need features such as 3D and Smart TV.  The picture quality is a good as the professional ratings say it is.  One thing I noticed is that the black is not inky black during scenes that are mostly shadows or completely black such as just before the credits role.  Also I noticed that the picture appears wavy when the color is solid gray such as a sky at dusk.The internet features are easy to configure.  Remember to set the tv date and time.  Netflix and Amazon won't connect without it.I ordered this product with enhanced delivery.  The delivery went well even though they didn't show up during the estimated time frame and didn't call to let me know they were going to be late.  Also, the delivery date was changed because the product was shipped earlier than estimated.  CEVA told me I had to contact the company that actually delivered and set up the tv.  I had difficulty getting through to them.  No one answered the phone after 4:30pm even though they didn't close until 5:00pm.  I was finally able to get someone to answer after 8:30am the next day, was transferred, then hung up on 3 times.  The fourth time I called I asked why they kept hanging up on me, and he said "we've been having problems with the phones."  Really.  I don't fault Amazon or CEVA for the communication issues between customer and the delivery service.

Reviews.Title: TV for the family room
Reviews.Author: Jerry Jones
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is outstanding.  We use this set to watch sporting events most of the time.  The plasma picture is almost 3D with it's high quality.  I am sorry to hear that Panasonic will stop producing these products in 2014.  The quality of the picture on this plasma set is much better that what we have observed on LED Liquid Crystal sets.

Reviews.Title: The HDTV was everything we thought it would be
Reviews.Author: Debbie Evano
Reviews.Content: We chose the Panasonic TC P65S60 65" to replace our 42" which is still working great after 10 yrs.  The 42" is in our spare bedroom now.  I would recommend a Panasonic to anyone who ask about it.  The delivery was on time.  The only thing was about 6 hrs after we ordered from you we were at Sams and the exact one was there for $111 cheaper and we couldn't cancel our order with you.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality is great and it was easy to set up.
Reviews.Author: James E Pierce
Reviews.Content: The unit arrived in good condition. The TV set up instructions were clear and easy to follow. We would recommend tis product to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Exactly as I had wanted
Reviews.Author: Dr. Prakash A Karpe
Reviews.Content: This TV is just what I wanted. It has great picture quality, good quality sound (although I do plan to install a home theater system), and easy controls. The Internet connection is fast and WiFi set up is a breeze.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV with not a single problem
Reviews.Author: Tractorman
Reviews.Content: I was worried about buying a TV online, but the price was too good to pass up. It was delivered fast and in perfect condition.  This is my third Panasonic, I will never buy another brand if i can help it.

Reviews.Title: Solid Quality
Reviews.Author: B. Valentine
Reviews.Content: The picture is great and the motion handling is awesome. One complaint is a lack of inputs. Unfortunately the WII is a composite output and the current DVD player is component. It needed to be upgraded so I could hook up via HDMI. huge hassle from that perspective and the real draw back is there are only 3 HDMI inputs so if this isn't for your home theater it could be an issue for you too.

Reviews.Title: Insane value for a 60" plasma
Reviews.Author: SciroccoTDI
Reviews.Content: Amazing picture - incredible brightness...and just minor buzzing if you get your head near it (and I live at 5000+ feet, where the pressure of the gas tends to push the glass plates apart and cause problems).  PS - I got this when it was 999.99 - don't know why the price shot up since my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase.
Reviews.Author: A. Bates "shopping diva"
Reviews.Content: Great tv. Like my Sony, it has apps like Cinema Now, Netflix, Hulu Plus, Vudu and Amazon Prime for wi-fi streaming of movies. The remote is quick and responsive with a dedicated Netflix button (too bad I canceled my Netflix a year ago.) I'm not crazy about the glare. The only negative is, the screen is not matte like my Sharp, Sony,Sanyo or TCL. So be aware of a slight glare when viewing.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this purchase
Reviews.Author: Top Ten Top Ten List
Reviews.Content: I've always been very happy with my Panasonic purchases, and this is no exception. The picture is great, the controls are intuitive, the tv itself is sleek and simple. But by far, the best part about this purchase was the team that delivered it! They went above and beyond- moved our old TV, unpacked and connected the new tv, set up the new remote, and took all the packaging with them. I had no idea we were getting "white glove" delivery with this purchase - what a pleasant surprise!

Reviews.Title: Big TV for a Big Room
Reviews.Author: Spectre
Reviews.Content: If all you are after is a big plasma display without the fancy features, this is it.  It has all the picture quality you expect in a plasma from Panasonic, at a great price.  It is sad to know they won't be making them much longer...

Reviews.Title: I absolutley LOVE the Quality of the picture on this TV!
Reviews.Author: G1yp4.1337
Reviews.Content: I have been looking at midrange TV's for the last 2 years. I have looked at LCD, LED-LCD, and Plasma.  I fell in love with the quality of plazma when my parents bought one that i recomended. Even looking at the TV's at wal-mart, any plasma outshined the LCD's in quality every time.  I never saw this TV in real life till i hooked it up, but i know panasonic's Flat pannels were allways very crisp and of good quality. When this one went on sale, I jumped on it.Now, About the Tv:  First, i want to address the elephant in the room. If you have read the reviews like i have, MANY complained about the glare on the screen.  It IS a glossy screen and it WILL reflect light. That said, im looking at the screen right now and i do have some glare from my window on it, but its not enough for me not to enjoy the picture.  If i was watching tv all day long, then i could see it being a problem during the day, but not at night.  At night, i will get a reflection of a light thats about 30 feet behind it, but again, its not a big deal.  If your gaming, i could see it being a little bit of an issue but my solution was to wall mount the tv, and tilt it down.. Its enough to remove any washout.  This is a problem with MOST plasma's that have a glossy screen.. The Glossy screen provides a clearer picture as a matte screen blurs it a bit. Its a personal choice. And if you get the tv and its a rather big issue for you, with the price point of this tv you can buy the 100 dollar screen overlays that reduce the glare and still have a great valuethe smart tv..  Netflix, Amazon prime and youtube are what i use.  I love that these are built into the TV, freeing up an HDMI port (which there are only 2 on this tv, but that is easily expanded with a 10 dollar HDMI switch with remote from amazon).  My bone of contention here are the speed in which the services work when going through the menus (especially youtube).  Sometimes they lag.. quite a bit. (Its not my internet as i have a 50/2mb pipe). My other issue is amazon instant video.  There is NO OPTION FOR YOUR WATCHLIST!  This was my biggest feature on my ROKU that i loved. Now i have to search for my movie every time instead of queing up movies or tv shows to watch in the future.  This software version was only released a few months ago and maybe they will patch itThe DLNA option works great as well. I have a media server on my network were i stream my movies instead of disc searching.All in all, this was a 5 star purchase for me, and i would buy another in a seccond if i had that kind of money :)  If you are VERY sensitive to light on your screen when you watch TV, Then dont buy this tv, Go look at the S64, or get a plasma glare filter.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: scouthoward
Reviews.Content: This is the best tv I've ever owned. The picture clarity is beautiful and I like the smart tv features. I would highly reccomend this tv because you get a lot of tv for the money.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional Picture - Great Price No Frills Plasma
Reviews.Author: Brian Maloney
Reviews.Content: Like most, I researched the purchase of a new tv quite a bit.  I was already sold on plasma over LCD from my previous plasma (an LG that was messed up in lightening strike).  Amazon had the best price ($300.00 lower than Sears).  Probably the best bang for the buck in the 65" range.  And a GREAT picture.I know many have mentioned the glare...I find Panasonic no different than any other plasma screen from a glare standpoint.  The picture is very, very good.  Excellent and as describe by the others that have reviewed.  Set up of this t.v. was very, very easy.My only caution would be that it has only two HDMI inputs.  This was fine for me as I feed the t.v. with an A/V receiver that has 6 HDMI inputs.  However, if you don't have an A/V reciever, realize that you will only have two HDMI inputs.  One for satellite/cable...if you use the other for a DVD player...you're out of inputs!Great delivery by Amazon.  Great price.  Super picture!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Adam Neel
Reviews.Content: Things to consider when buying any TV.Do you care more about the TV's relative brightness or ability to see shadows in dark scenes of movies?If you care more about the 1st then get an LCD. If you care more about the 2nd get a plasma.I had an Samsung LCD for the last 5 years. It had a good picture quality for sports and regular shows. However, when it came to watching movies. Especially movies with dark scenes. I could not make out anything in the picture. (think the Dark Knight).I bought this TV a month ago and I am very impressed. I read the reviews and went with the S and not the ST. Here is my feedback on the reviews.Is the screen glossy/reflective?Yes it is glossy, but I personally do not find it distracting at all. The picture quality is amazing. This TV sits in a room with windows on three walls and lots of lamps and I have never once been distracted. I think the people who see reflections on the screen out showing the TV's picture are wanting to see the reflections. My wife and I have both tried and focused so as to get distracted and the TV just wins out. In fact I am sitting in front of it right now as I write this review with a lamp turned on and the sun out and the picture is as clear as day.Is it very bright?No its not as bright as my old LCD but it looks great the picture is much more accurate, real to life. Things do not tend to look neon or blind you when the TV is on in a dark room.Black LevelInfinitely better than my last TV or any other LCD I have ever looked at myself. The big problem with LCD is even when they get close to plasma in black level they cost $2000-$3000 more and they still do not look as black. This TV essentially looks like it is off when it is at black screen. I know that CNET has calibrators that can tell how much light comes out but if you do not have one you will not notice that it might not be as black as the VT.Apps/InternetThis is the part I cared about the least. I was very happy it had amazon instant video as I am a prime customer and this made it much easier to access. However, I do not care if my TV runs tons of apps. That is what my Apple TV, iPad, iPhone, Laptop... etc. are for and it always seems the TV versions are clunky. If I really want to run those things its easier and faster to just use airplay.Bottom LineIf you want a big TV with excellent picture quality for not much money... this is your TV. If you want to spend more for an LCD be my guest. You will not be sorry you purchased a 65" TV. I was nervous at 1st to get a TV this big. It has double the area of my old 46" but I have not once regretted it. My wife who could not possibly care less even said that the TV is a good size.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: We have certainly enjoyed our new 65" TV! The picture quality is wonderful. I am not all that impressed with the sound on the TV but it is ok. We need to get a sound bar and that should take care of the situation. I feel like we got a very good TV for a nice price. We researched on CNET and Consumer Reports and found that Panasonic was one of the best rated plasma TV's. I would recommend this to anyone. The color is great and the clarity is wonderful. I will say, it is tough to watch a smaller TV now!

Reviews.Title: Great TV, no pointless bells & whistles
Reviews.Author: Buffalo
Reviews.Content: This model shone in all the reviews, and it's easy to see why: high quality and great value. The only downside is the amount of TV I'm now watching.

Reviews.Title: Nice work, Panasonic. No complaints here.
Reviews.Author: Scott Pezza
Reviews.Content: This TV is very well priced, has a nice picture, has better sound than I expected, and hooked into our wireless network easily. I think that the omission of an integrated webcam is actually a benefit.A few notes: - The glass screen can be subject to some glare. Even in bright conditions, it's fine for me up to about 45 degrees from center. As you get farther to the side, you can still see the picture but the glare really kicks in. For settings with a lot of direct light, you may be better off with the higher model that has an anti-reflective screen. - The sound is not going to blow you away. It's fine -- better than I expected, but nothing groundbreaking. - It you use a slimline mount, make sure you wire everything ahead of time. Since the inputs are in the back, rather than on the side, they will be very difficult to access after mounting. The USB ports are on the side, though, so there's no worry there.

Reviews.Title: I took a risk
Reviews.Author: Alix V
Reviews.Content: So I've been wanting to get a new tv and a motorcycle so I didn't want to break the piggy bank getting a tv.I did a lot of reading and settled on several Tv's from plasma to LCD and below what this tv cost to above.After reading quite a bit of reviews all over the net and seeing this model in person I honestly was impressed by reviews online but not impressed by the picture quality in person. I'm not sure why but the picture looked horrible!So I went with the reviews and purchased it in hopes I could mess with the settings and make it look great. So guess what it is friggen awesome!Watching bluray movies the picture quality was good but not great. Where the tv shines is when I play video games and watching Hulu, vudu, or the other services provided on the tv or ps3.I'm honestly blown away and after very little tweaking the last of us look really good.So if I would recommend this? Totally!As for the cons?Yes as of all plasmas or most you will have a reflection and if you set the tv in a great location with medium light or the ability to control light levels like I can then this purchase would be a great one... If you can't control the light then you will honestly hate it.

Reviews.Title: best money, i ever spent
Reviews.Author: steven howell
Reviews.Content: I know there is better hdtv's out there, but I dont care about 3D, and Ive have a light controlled room (a must with this tv), just awesome!

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: MadJoe
Reviews.Content: Enough said.  But I have to type at least 20 words, so I'll also say: at this price buy two.  And I'll add some cons since the review would be way to long to read if I listed everything I like about this set.There are only 2 cons I have found so far:1. There is an LED on the TV that lights up when it is on.  This isn't unusual, but it is red and constantly grabs my eye when watching TV when it's dark in the room.  I have recently become acutely aware of all the LEDs manufacturers are putting all over their products in an attempt to look cool, or modern, and it's annoying.  When the TV is on, I am aware of it by the picture being displayed on it.2. The only Audio output is Fiber Optic.  I would have preferred a digital out RCA jack, but at least there is one.That's pretty much it.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely Beautiful Picture - Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Kevin Miller
Reviews.Content: First things first, the picture on this tv is absolutely beautiful.  Darks are dark, colors are vibrant - By far the best picture you'll find at this price and beats most of the more expensive tv's as well!Smart features are nice to have but pretty much useless for me as they take quite a while to load and my blu-ray player does a much better job of handling apps, etc.Sound quality (as is the norm with today's televisions) is not great so I would definitely recommend investing in other speakers if you don't already have them.All-in-all, the picture is really what is important to me and I must say that the picture on this tv blew me away.. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Sahib S. Dhindsa
Reviews.Content: Awesome TVThere is a reflection like some of the other reviews say. But, I honestly don't notice it too much once you get used to it. The TV speakers are pretty good also.

Reviews.Title: NO Anti-Glare coating....SO WHAT?
Reviews.Author: Edwin Sanchez
Reviews.Content: I received my TC-P65S60 from amazon 3 days ago. Maybe is because its in my room, but don't see the big deal with the no "anti-reflective" coating. To me this TV is awesome!!!!!  Previously i had a panasonic 50" plasma that i bought in costco 7 years ago, it came with the AR coating, after comparing both, didn't need it. 1st test drive was with Tron Legacy and Batman The Dark Knight. MAN!!! The picture is amazing. Don't watch from up close though, you can see a bit of grainy pictures, but from 7 feet back, WOW just WOW.Currently doing my break-in routine, no black bars and no logos for 100 hours. Yet everything looks amazing.Plus the applications are.... VERY GOOD! I play a lot of MKV video files and this tv plays them well.  I've never seen a tv that provides this level of support for MKV files. I mean you can change language, subtitles, fast-forward and rewind. I'm extremely impressed and happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: cnhurley
Reviews.Content: Love this TV.The deliver was excellent. I would recommend this plasma television to anyone interested in a new television.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture
Reviews.Author: hankthecowdog
Reviews.Content: I like the smart TV features, easy to use, but sadly no HBOGO.  My last TV was an 8 year old Samsung 40" and I gotta say the sound was vastly superior.  The sound on this TV is totally unacceptable, really ruins the whole experience.  So now I have to invest in a decent sound bar.  I'm guessing this is kind of the norm now, but something to consider when it comes to bottom line price.

Reviews.Title: Picture Quaity Will Knock Your Socks Off
Reviews.Author: M. Balthrop
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is fantastic. The built in DLNA with built in wireless is also very satisfying. It streams 1080p across my WIFI with minimal setup. The only gripe is that it has only 2 HDMI ports and no headphone or audio out other than digital out.

Reviews.Title: It's shiny
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: The picture is great when you're sitting in the right spot to avoid the glare. The screen has almost a mirror like finish which is very shiny. Other wise, it's been fine so far. Probably have to put up some dark curtains in the living room to block out the light.

Reviews.Title: Dim
Reviews.Author: Marshall
Reviews.Content: I bought the 42 inch version of this TV (P42S60) and no matter what changes I make to the picture, I can't get it as bright as my 2008 Panasonic Plasma. Picture is too dim in my opinion. CATS off, panel brightness high, contrast turned up, etc. Am I doing something wrong? Unfortunately it may have to go back.UPDATE 8-19-13: I ended up returning the TV because of the brightness issue. I bought a used 2009 model and it's much brighter.

Reviews.Title: Spectacular color. Amazing price for a plasma of this quality.
Reviews.Author: Dao Shen
Reviews.Content: I deliberately picked this model for the bright screen as i use this unit mostly at night.Glare in the day is noticeable but not unwatchable.Refresh rate for gaming is perfect. I plan to buy 2 more at this price to create a surround display gaming setup.

Reviews.Title: It does well what i can see
Reviews.Author: Rhea Wheeliums
Reviews.Content: I have this television in my bedroom and it is working well. I have no complaints.  The first set that was delivered was cracked.  Amazon replaced it promptly without any difficulties.

Reviews.Title: Everything I wanted
Reviews.Author: S. Weilacher
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic Plasma TV is wonderful. Very clear picture. Good clear sound. Better sound that any other TV I have had.Easy to set up. I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: flawless picture.
Reviews.Author: john mc
Reviews.Content: iv'e owned panasonic plasmas for nearly seven years and they keep getting better. outstanding blacks and colors even on network tv broadcast over satellite. blu rays are pristine too. btw, none of my plasma tv's have ever suffered from image retention, all of them still look beautiful, even my old 42 inch non hd model which had many hours of video games has no issues. this model is a "mirror" though, so don't put it in a room next to a window if you do a lot of daytime tv watching. some people gripe about only 2 hdmi inputs, but for me running it though an av receiver makes it a non issue. shipping was great too. this is a set that would make your home theater really shine.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Myona Baser
Reviews.Content: Met with all expectations. Great picture and the smart capabilities are easy. I have and would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: Upgraded to Panasonic TC-P50S60 50" Plasma from Vizio 37" LCD
Reviews.Author: pixelPimp
Reviews.Content: Extremely happy with the TC-P50S60 50" Panasonic Plasma. We were in need of a TV on our enclosed patio so I convinced my wife that we should move the Vizio on to the patio and buy a new display for the living room. The living room has a large bay window on the left side of the room and a regular window in the back of the room which is parallel to the TV. Room is about 14' x 18'. I feel the 50" tv is a perfect fit for the room, I wouldn't buy anything larger. The room is fairly bright and we are not experiencing problems with reflections or the images not being bright enough. Blacks are black like most of the reviews you read. Skin tones are great and not over saturated. Angle viewing is great as well. I'm not a big sports guy but having this TV makes me want to watch sports because of how clear and sharp things are. Downloaded the Panasonic app to swipe and share images/videos from Apple devices and it works well. Bought a Sony BluRay player with this unit as well and they play nice with each other.Sony BDP-S3100 Blu-ray Disc Player with Wi-FiDelivery service was a nice addition. They setup a window from 9am to 12pm to deliver. Service un-packaged the unit, plugged it in so I could inspect the display. FYI - They do not plugin your audio/video equipment or hang it on the wall, they just fire it up to allow you to view that the unit works and there aren't any issues with the screen.Highly recommend this unit.

Reviews.Title: Incredible bang for buck
Reviews.Author: Samuel D Mertens
Reviews.Content: Great display, integrates well into my home theater system. This *is* a budget system, so beware that there are a limited number of inputs (two HDMI, one composite/component).  You'll need a receiver for more.  The screen is kind of glossy, which is not a problem in my setup but something they address in higher models.  Another minor caveat: when using a wireless network connection, it takes a few seconds (30?) to come online after power up.  So if you just hit the power button then try to go directly to Netflix, it will complain about a lack of network.  Go wired if you can.  Note that if you start the network setup wizard in an attempt to fix things, it'll nuke your existing WPA settings, including the passphrase which is probably a real pain to input via remote.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: BJS_ATL
Reviews.Content: This is my first foray into the flat-screen TV world. I searched around for several seeks and found the Panasonic TCP50S60 to be far and away the best value for the money. I wanted a new TV primarily to watch movies. My priorities fare sharp picture, Smart TV, and price. This TV was at least $200 cheaper than any alternative.The picture is fantastic. There are five main picture settings (standard, home theater, etc.). I haven't played around too much with them, but I've been able to get a great picture watching sports, movies, and TV with one of the base modes. There are many more picture options, like changing RGB colors in different modes, if you want to get into all of that.It's easy to set-up and light-weight. I mounted it above my fireplace. The mount weights twice as much as the TV. It had two HDMI inputs, which is fine for me. One goes to my Roku, one to my Blue ray player. I haven't used the USB ports yet.The sound is pretty good on its own. My living room is pretty small, so the TV fills the room with sound very well.My living room is also pretty dark, so I haven't had any complaints about glare or poor quality in high light settings like other reviewers have mentioned.The set-up and remote are straightforward. Once mounted, I got everything connected and hooked up to wifi in about 45 minutes.I love this TV. I honestly have no complaints. I'm not a gamer or in need of extra HDMI ports or in need 3D, so this was perfect for me.Best purchase I've made in some time.

Reviews.Title: Dynamite Picture!
Reviews.Author: William Bretz "Bill Bretz"
Reviews.Content: Had the TV for about a month now.  It replaced a aging Samsung DLP that was developing problems deciding what input it wanted to use.  I was always very happy with the picture on the Samsung, and was actually a little apprehensive about going to a plasma.  But, wow!  Out of the box...  Much, much better picture.  The contrast ratio is much better, particularily on the black side.  Also the viewing angle is better (although this wasn't an issue with the Samsung).I do have two small negatives.  One is that there isn't a headphone jack, and the other is that the on-board sound isn't even close to spectacular.  Looks like an updated sound system is in our future!UPDATE:  September 9, 2013.Bought the Panasonic SCHT370 2.1 sound system for it.  Now I have spectacular sound and picture for an investment of less than $900!!

Reviews.Title: incredible picture
Reviews.Author: Speed Freak
Reviews.Content: I replaced a Hitachi director series 55" and this plasma ROCKS! Right out of the box she looks amazing. I have only had her a few days but for now I am stoked. I only wish the auto off function without signal was shorter than 10m but i cant be critical. I love the smoothness and flow of plasmas!

Reviews.Title: Great TV Great Price
Reviews.Author: jeeper87
Reviews.Content: Its a great TV and with no tax and free sipping, its a steal. I would recommend it to anyone interested in a Plasma

Reviews.Title: Stunning experience that rivals a movie theater in my living room
Reviews.Author: M. Rose
Reviews.Content: I don't fret endlessly over specs and reviews, but I did a fair amount of looking around before buying this TV.  I felt 3D was a gimmick that I would not use very much, if at all, but I did want plasma picture quality.  Of course, Panasonic leads that plasma group, so this TV just naturally rose to the top.  I bought it on the Panasonic reputation because not many reviews were in at the time, but this TV has exceeded all of my expectations by a wide margin.  Zero ghosting (and I tested it some--like hours), does not get very hot and the picture quality regardless of the source is unbelievable.  I have a very large living room and this TV was mounted over a gas fireplace, and it fills that void very well.  Skip the more expensive and somewhat fancier Panasonic plasmas and just buy this one.  It has all of the same picture quality, none of the features you don't need, all of the ones you do and the 65" size is something to behold.  Highly, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Best tv for the money
Reviews.Author: Brock E Wilt
Reviews.Content: I bought the 65 inch in the S series. This tv replaces my 2008 Panasonic 50px80u. I always thought my 50px80u had a great picture. No motion blur, nice blacks, and accurate colors. So when it came time for a new tv I knew I was buying another Panasonic. I would of liked to buy a higher end model, but when it comes down to it your just paying for 3d and some picture quality upgrades. For me I don't need 3d and can't justify spending another 800-1000 for a slightly better picture.The65s60 has a very good picture. Colors look life like and real. The blacks are also much deeper then on my old tv. I used picture settings I found on the owners thread for the S Series from the AVS forum.I will say this tv is more reflective then my old tv, but that doesn't bother me and for the most part I don't even notice it. Once the sun goes down its a non issue.I enjoy having Netflix, YouTube and a few other apps directly on my tv. But like most people I already can access these apps through my ps3 or cable box.Overall you won't go wrong buying this tv. You won't find a better tv for the price.

Reviews.Title: Not bright enough
Reviews.Author: David L. McCormick
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace an older Sony LCD TV, and I am disappointed in its very limited maximum brightness.  It is hung on a wall in my basement, so there is little natural light to overcome.  Hockey games are not bright enough, and i expected better for baseball.  Wouldn't buy this or any other plasma TV -- will stick to LCD, LED, or other technologies.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy
Reviews.Author: cyncynj
Reviews.Content: So far I like the TV. It has been hard for me to get used to having a plasma versus an LCD. I am missing the brightness of the screeen (due to the LCD having lighting behind the screen). The blacks and vivid colors are great. I also LOVE having access to You Tube, Amazon Prime, Hulu, Netflix directly to the TV via wireless connectivity to my router. The setup was relatively easy. The most difficult part is trying to get the picture set to where I like it. I must say that as other reviewers have said. The screen is HIGHLY Reflective. My tv is directly opposite windows which is not a good place. I will be installing some room darkening curtain or blinds to combat this issue.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Bainmeister
Reviews.Content: I bought this model because I wanted a great picture and I did not want to pay extra for all the frills. I had already visited sears and best buy and determined that the panasonics plasma is by far the best picture on the market. To my surprise, the TV has plenty of exciting features:1. The user interface: extremely easy to use and navigate, a 6 year old could work it2. Easy wifi setup, the remote has a Netflix button, again real easy to use3. Dlna technology made my smartphone come alive. Buttons now appeared on my smartphone's apps that let me broadcast straight to the TV . If I am watching youtube on my phone , touch a button and the TV switches over to YouTube and plays for all to see. I can stream music from my phone to the TV and the TV has a digital audio out to go to my receiver. I can also display pictures and videos from my phone to the TV . Absolutely satisfied. Word of warning , if you buy a TV mount with an arm that says it can hold 100 lbs, it will hold this TV (75 lbs) but it is scary and struggling . I ordered a better tv mount with dual arm that holds up to 165 and because of the dual arm , it should keep the TV straight all the time, no matter how you manipulate the tv. Oh yea, the amazon price drops a good $65 when you are in final stages of checkout, at least it did for me .

Reviews.Title: Great picture, amazing value
Reviews.Author: R. Williams
Reviews.Content: I've never owned a plasma tv before and am blown away by the picture on this set. It connects seamlessly to my wireless internet for youtube and netflix viewing.  I didn't need a huge screen for my smallish tv room and this is just right.  It will pay for itself by my not having to subscribe to cable anymore.  I have more tv than I'll ever watch with the internet channels which have their own button on the remote. I also got the remote ap hooked up on my phone so searching is much easier than using the remote. That would be one thing that may be a little gripe.  If you do a search with the remote, you have to bounce the curser around on a keyboard with the up/down/right/ left arrows.  Thats a pain but having the phone hooked up with it as the remote eliminates the problem. I just ordered a blue ray surround system for it and am anxious to see how that works out.

Reviews.Title: wonderful television
Reviews.Author: E. ELLIS
Reviews.Content: Once I decided that I was picking plasma over led/lcd my research took me straight to Panasonic. I eventually got this gem on a black Friday deal and have been extremely happy with the performance. Picture quality is outstanding (picked plasma for the high contrast and lively colors). Extra features aren't bad either, haven't had any issues with the onboard YouTube app if I want to quickly show a video on the big screen. It syncs to my Google account seamlessly. I did have some trouble connecting to Wi-Fi but opted to plug in since my model is in my entertainment center anyway. The sound is decent, but getting a solid 3.1 system will out the icing on the cake. The built in color settings are just fine, no extra tweaking was need to meet my satisfaction.Very happy with my purchase, couldn't have made a better decision.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Picture
Reviews.Author: Sparky
Reviews.Content: Purchased this product based on several reviews. Did not see the product prior to ordering. This unit has an outstanding picture quality. I have only made minor adjustments to it from out of the box. Many reviewers complained the  picture is not bright. I have no issues once I turned off the auto dimming feature. The screen is reflective but I have not had glare issues that could not be corrected. It is in my living room and can view during daytime with the blinds open.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv...use mostly for ps4
Reviews.Author: P. Suarez "Soul Surfer"
Reviews.Content: Amazing tv, has to be in very dark room.  Black out curtains during day, etc.  The color and clarity is fantastic.  Grab them if you can while the last! no burn in issues, over 500 hours on it so far easily.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic p50s60
Reviews.Author: W. Hue
Reviews.Content: Well I've lived the last 10 or so years without a television in my home.  I decided to upgrade because I was tired of streaming Netflix and Amazon on my 15in laptop.  After extensive research, I decided I wanted to try out a Panasonic plasma - just in time for them to have been officially discontinued and no longer in stock.I was able to snag the last Panasonic plasma in stock from my local Sears.  I got a 50in version of this model at a closeout price of ~$560.  I must say it's bigger than what I was originally looking for, but the 42 inch models were nowhere to be found locally or online.  For my first HDTV I am impressed - it delivers quality picture that seems to be lacking in a lot of the LCD/LED TVs I've seen.  Smart features are very basic and I really wish there was a Pandora app, but Youtube is free and easily paired with your computer or smartphone to make navigation/interface easier.  HuluPlus allows some free sampling of content.So far I am very happy I grabbed the last one of these available in my area and look forward to years of HD experience with this screen!

Reviews.Title: Audio output blocked for netflix
Reviews.Author: N. Shields
Reviews.Content: Panasonic and Netflix got together and blocked the audio output.  You can watch Netflix and listen on the TV speakers but if you want to output to your stereo system or headphones, you can't.  Everything but Netflix works fine.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Television Reasonably Priced
Reviews.Author: Joel
Reviews.Content: I bought the TC-P65S60 about four months ago and I'm honestly amazed by the picture quality to this day when I turn the TV on. I seems like the picture is just as good as a family members Samsung 64" plasma. While it May not have all of the features of the samsung like 3D it's picture quality is right up there. Every time someone sits down they are amazed by the picture quality. I'm sure glad I bought this TV when I did because about one month later I heard that Panasonic isn't making plasma anymore. Which is a bummer because I would definitely buy from Panasonic again.

Reviews.Title: TV works well
Reviews.Author: James Moore
Reviews.Content: TV works just fine.  Have no problems with picture; however, wouldn't bother with another internet connected TV.  DVD player and other accessories come with internet connectivity and do the job.

Reviews.Title: This is a Great TV
Reviews.Author: Matthew E. Mazur
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad that I purchased this when I did as Panasonic announced that they were getting out of the plasma game. Since that time, the price for this set increased by 60%!The picture quality, internet connectivity and speed to navigate menus on this set are second to none.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: Victor M Garcia
Reviews.Content: After calibrating the plasma and setting it in a low light environment I was blown away by the picture quality. If you can still find this TV at a reasonable price I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality, fairly good as PC monitor.
Reviews.Author: Michael Robinson
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to add to the conversation about this display for watching movies or playing games, the response time and quality are both excellent for the price.However, I do use this TV as a computer monitor and that has created some issues. Mainly, I have yet to find a totally satisfactory solution to the ultra-sharpness you see on text and window/image borders when hooked up to a PC via HDMI. There are dozens of suggestions to mitigate this problem (dropping Sharpness, changing the input label to "Monitor", etc), but none really eliminate it.My solution thus far lies in the HDMI Content Type settings. You can change this setting via the television (Menu > Picture > Advanced Picture > HDMI content type) or your PC's graphics settings, at least with Nvidia cards. When set to "Photo" mode, oh my goodness, the difference is night and day. The odd halos surrounding text and edges disappear and everything is so much easier on the eyes. The downside? Video as well as games are a little blurrier.The Nvidia software offers some dynamic control over HDMI content type, but I haven't been able to achieve the desired result from it (soft desktop, sharp fullscreen video/games). So if I want to eliminate the blur while playing a game or watching a YouTube video, I have to manually change the HDMI content type. I don't bother, I just live with the blur since it's not that severe, but if anyone has any better solutions I would love to hear them.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: Jenny DB "Jenny DB"
Reviews.Content: Great picture, phenomenal sound quality. Love this TV and found the best price on Amazon. Was a better deal than Costco, BestBuy, etc.

Reviews.Title: Have been very pleased with this TV
Reviews.Author: CAC "caccool15"
Reviews.Content: The ordering and delivery process were fantastic and smooth. Delivery was scheduled and arrived quickly. The guys who brought it were professional and checked to make sure the TV worked and was not damaged before leaving it.I really like the picture quality which is nice, and the built in Netflix and Amazon apps are appreciated. It isn't as bright as LED/LCD, but for me it is bright enough, even with lights on. That said, there is some reflection if you have lamps in the room behind the TV, they sometimes are visible in the reflection. Most of the time you don't notice it unless you are looking, but occasionally one will catch your eye. I considered paying more for the next model up which is also a Panasonic Plasma, but with more of a matte finish to reduce reflection/glare, but it was quite a bit more expensive. In hindsight, I'm glad I made the decision that I did. I've been satisfied w/ this TV, and the glare/reflection aren't bad enough for me to wish for something else.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS TV!
Reviews.Author: Alicia
Reviews.Content: This is our first plasma and we love it! We keep it in the basement where there isn't much natural light. Love the color quality and the Amazon delivery is free, they set it up and it was cheaper than at big box stores!

Reviews.Title: Great! Excellent plazma.
Reviews.Author: Guy
Reviews.Content: I actually bought a Vizio LED at Costco and took it back the first week.  Picture quality was poor.  Stand was so weak, it would not hold the TV square to the floor.  I had previously purchased a Panasonic plazma and was very happy with it, but could not find any locally.  I was skeptical about spending $700 for a television on-line.  It was delivered by motor freight.  The price was varying seemingly by the hour--going up!This is a great product.  If you watch sports, there is no better TV, regardless of the money. Settings are available for the demanding people we have become.  Having said that it is amazing to see how much lighter this TV is over the one I bought 5 years ago.  One draw back to plazma is that the screen is reflective in sunlight.  This is particularly noticeable when the TV is off, but some will notice when it is on.  The quality of the picture more than makes up for this.

Reviews.Title: Love our Panasonic TV
Reviews.Author: Mary ann Klubek
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality. Our second Panasonic TV and never had any problems  Very reliable.  Never had to call for repairs.

Reviews.Title: You got to love it!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Carlo
Reviews.Content: I love my tv. I chose panasonic because is just the best out there. Worth every peney of it and QUALITY.

Reviews.Title: Price meets Value
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain "John Hancock"
Reviews.Content: Great quality and color. if you can live with just two HDMI jacks then no reason to pay an extra 500-1000 bucks for a bunch of extra complexity.  Easy to set up Netflix and Amazon Prime and stream movies/shows.  Amazon delivery was great too. Brought it up stairs to my bonus room, unpacked it, made sure it worked and took away all of the packaging.

Reviews.Title: So Pleases
Reviews.Author: Michael Kwaiser
Reviews.Content: This is not only the best TV I have ever owned ( I am 63 yrs. old)  The delivery men were superior. Not only did that take great pains in being careful, but they set it up and made sure everything was working. They then took all the boxes  and cleaned up their mess.The TV is superior in everyway and your price and the price of extended warranty were unmatchable.Amazon, keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: perfect for 2D home theater in darkened room
Reviews.Author: exclaim!
Reviews.Content: The picture is wonderful, especially fitting for a home theater, as long as you have a fairly dark room. It is true what others have said about the reflectivity of the screen - it is very reflective and will not work well for viewing in daylight nor with anything but a dim light in the room. If you have a bright light in front of the room, you will see yourself in the screen, and if you have a bright light in the back of the room, you will see the walls and bookshelves (whatever) in the screen.Luckily, my viewing is almost all at night (and certainly all my premium viewing time is) and I prefer a darkened room with the full home theater treatment (4" acoustic panels, heavy curtains, 7.2 surround), so this is PERFECT for me. The color and blacks just blow me away.It's an amazing TV, and an incredible deal  at a bit over a grand (open box, nothing wrong with it, probably returned because of the reflectivity issue), and I'm sorry to hear Panasonic is leaving the plasma market, but happy I was able to get an upgrade of my first plasma (2009-era 54" Panasonic Viera, which was great too).Get one if the conditions are right for you and enjoy an incredible bargain. If you don't have the right conditions, do not buy this.

Reviews.Title: Very good larger size (50") HDTV
Reviews.Author: Cranky old guy
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, very inexpensive HDTV. The "smart TV" function is good if limited. Of cours, I'm a Roku head, so the limitations are irrelevant in my case. The set is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Al A
Reviews.Content: Product was easy to assemble, clear directions great color, clarity, detail.  Fits in with my location so I do not have reflection issues, angle viewing is great, HMDI and internet connection all easy. Sound is fine, but i do intend to get a sound bar.

Reviews.Title: Great screen
Reviews.Author: Julie "juliedolls"
Reviews.Content: It's a plasma TV. We chose it over the LED model because it is more easily viewed from an angle. LED units must be viewed "head on" for best picture quality. We still have not explored all of the features in the set, but we like what we have seen so far.

Reviews.Title: Very nice picture quality, but....
Reviews.Author: ErPort
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with the TV. Only two issues: When the screen is showing a lot of white or brighter colors, it begins to flicker. Not bad, but noticeable. It also makes a humming sound when the screen is bright, but that's easily drowned out by the sound from whatever you're watching.Overall, it's worth the buy for the price I got it.

Reviews.Title: Great out of the box
Reviews.Author: Dan Anderson
Reviews.Content: The Panasonic replaced an older Sony CRT TV. The quality of the picture is much better but the best feature for me was the weight. The old one weighed almost 300 pounds! It was a snap to set up and I love the all of the features such as internet access with Netflix and You Tube. It was priced right also!!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding value and generally excellent, though does have some flaws.
Reviews.Author: Randall J. Wetmore
Reviews.Content: Overall, the picture quality is excellent and can be very finely adjusted via 'Pro Settings', but it is somewhat dim and there is noticeable banding in some content due to the limited steps of gradation (6144 vs. 12288 on the ST60).  It is quite reflective due to no A/R filter, but I'm one who thinks an A/R filter slightly reduces the transparency of the image, so I prefer none.Definitely recommended if you can still find it in stock somewhere (these are disappearing fast).

Reviews.Title: Gamer's Delight
Reviews.Author: Mario A. Gallardo "OmegaWari0"
Reviews.Content: After countless hours of research i found this TV to be the ULTIMATE BANG 4 UR BUCK! There are lot of reviews that have lots of details let face it, if ur looking at this TV ur a gamer like me so your inpatient. Here are bullet points of what you should consider b4 buying.1.The blacks are like batman taking in a bath with JET black ink, while being surrounded by a black hole.2.Input lag : 29.2 ms ( 1 of the fastest there is)3.Plasma Will always bet LCD when it comes to picture quality.4.Very affordable ( i bought at 599$) before black Friday at black Friday it was 899!CONS:1. Mirror image screen, Definitely not suitable for a room with windows or lights!2. Sound quality is bad like all TVSSummary: A must buy IF you can control your lighting otherwise i would avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: King of the Plasmas
Reviews.Author: Ken Balog
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Pictire, great looking TV, brilliant colors with deep blacks and no jitter for  fast sports., Very easy setup, Can't imagine a better TV

Reviews.Title: Stunning TV. Plasma is the way to go!
Reviews.Author: VegasRPh "VegasRPh"
Reviews.Content: I have owned this awesome Panasonic 60" plasma TV for about 2 years. I paid $949 plus tax for it at a local store. The picture quality is just so perfect and can be viewed at different angles without any problem. 600hz refresh rate = NO MOTION BLUR what-so-ever. NFL Football looks amazing on this plasma, so does gaming systems (PS3/Wii). I did use a picture calibration DVD and fine tuned the picture to a point that anytime people see the TV they always comment on how SHARP the picture is. BLU Ray DVDs will blow your mind......just awesome.Panasonic makes the BEST plasma TVs in my opinion. I hope this set lasts me another 5-6yrs and then I can get a 70" Panasonic plasma Smart TV for cheap in the future. By then, a 70" TV should be around $800 or less. YEAH!

Reviews.Title: Best Tv I've ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Tim Dye "Mat"
Reviews.Content: I've owned this TV for two years, perfect! Never had a problem with it! Going to buy another for my wife soon!

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: Bodie Correll
Reviews.Content: Great tv. Good picture. Easy setup. Internet apps easy to use and setup. Best tv out there for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great budget big-screen plasma with several caveats...
Reviews.Author: Christopher Bryant
Reviews.Content: Great value plasma HDTV as long as you can accept the tradeoffs.  The two reasons I returned this model (ultimately for an ST50 from last year) were the excessive plasma buzz (audible on a white screen even at high volumes because it's so high pitched, but I may have gotten a lemon, who knows) and the mirror-like reflectivity of the screen.In a (very) dark room with your surround sound turned up loud, the picture quality of this tv will amaze you for the price, and I'm not sure I would have considered another tv had those conditions satisfied me.  Unfortunately I don't want to watch tv only in the dark and I also like to watch tv at reasonable volumes, so this model wasn't for me.  But if you're on a budget and don't have windows or lamps shining light anywhere near the screen, you'll love this television.

Reviews.Title: Amazing television
Reviews.Author: JSmith
Reviews.Content: Well, I dont know if I got lucky or what. I ordered this TV about 5 weeks ago and it was priced at $999.  Then it jumped to $1499 two days after I ordered it.  Now it's at $1599.  Are Panny Plasmas becoming more valuable because they announced they're not going to make them after 2014? Couldn't tell you.The skinny -- at $999 this TV is an AMAZING value.  At $1599 it's more like a very good value.  As others have said, in a dark room, movies and video games are just an absolute joy to watch.  The darks are incredible.  PS4 games look amazing.  The two HDMI  is, at least for me, not the least bit problematic.  And I've actually found that general lighting in a room does not degrade the picture much at all -- HOWEVER, direct light facing the screen is an absolute no-no. If you have a lamp or a window that is facing the screen it will cause serious mischief.  If you can control this one variable, however, it is a GREAT TV. Period.The other big knock is that plasmas cant produce whites and bright images like LCDs/LEDs.  This is my first plasma and I can say: that is clearly true.  If you really value bright whites or use your TV primarily for, say, watching hockey, this is probably not the TV for you.  I was worried about this myself, but found out very quickly that the ability to produce darker blacks has a much greater effect on image quality than the ability to produce bright whites. It's hard to explain, but there's a reason every cinephile and tech website (like CNET), raves about Panny plasmas and the darks they produce.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv..minus one thing
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: This television seriously needs more HD outputs as well as RCA outputs especially being a plasma. Biggest disappointment with the tv, other than that a seriously nice tv with great picture and color!

Reviews.Title: Great TV with one minor issue...
Reviews.Author: EddieInAZ
Reviews.Content: I rate this HDTV 4.5 stars even though their systems only allows whole star ratings.  This is my third Panasonic Plasma and second from Amazon.Our 42" and 50" Panny Plasmas were rock solid and had no problems for 5 years.  This reliability and great picture is the reason I sold our 42" inch and bought this 65".  Movies and sports are great to watch on this behemoth.The picture, built in wireless and apps are fantastic, and Amazon's price and service are second to none.  It would rate 5 stars, but the screen glare (from windows and lights) is noticeable.  I'm told there is this same TV with a no-glare screen (with a different model number), but that is not what Amazon sells.

Reviews.Title: Too much reflection
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Seymore
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture is ruined by the highly reflective screen. My older 50" Panasonic plasma does not have these reflections. Why is it built this way?

Reviews.Title: Great picture, quality product.
Reviews.Author: Patrick J Devor
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from the 50" Panasonic that I bought 3 years ago. It too, works like a champ.  Love this TV, picture is awesome, quality is great, even the sound is not bad. I bought a sound bar b/c I thought it would need it, but in reality, the speakers are adequate. Like other people have stated, there is glare if in a bright room-turn the lights down, close the blinds, etc. For the price, this unit can't be beat. I'd buy another one tomorrow. No regrets.

Reviews.Title: Perfect - for me
Reviews.Author: David J. Silver "davyboy"
Reviews.Content: Great right out of the box.  The display was too vivid for my taste, but with the Panasonic super easy menu system, it took a moment to correct.  The TV is smart enough to have several streaming choices available with very little setup - due to the excellent wireless internet built-in.  It automatically detected my Note 3 and I was able to stream music, photos, and videos with no effort on my part.  I paid $679 delivered for it.  If you can find it anywhere in that range, snatch it up - it's definitely a keeper.  Don't put much stock in the problems people note about the TV reflecting light too much.  If you watch a lot of TV during the light of day, close a drape or 2 - no  big deal at all.  The quality of the picture is just awesome - you can't go wrong buying it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture
Reviews.Author: Ken Kundrik
Reviews.Content: EXCELLENT picture, very good viewing angle, loads of features. Set up was easy hooked to our network very simply. I have not connectedto our computer yet.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, yes light reflection can be an issue
Reviews.Author: David Dare
Reviews.Content: Yes, the screen reflects a lot in heavy light conditions, as reported.  The picture, the settings, are all spectacular for us.  We are very pleased with the picture.  A very nice television for the price.  We wish we could have purchased the 42", but it was unavailable.  The resolution is noticeably better with all of our DVDs, not just the blu-ray discs.  (Coming from a 720p Panasonic)

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: Ryan Rumbaugh
Reviews.Content: Got the infamous 7 red blinking lights which causes the TV to power off randomly. Naturally this started happening after the 'enhanced' delivery guy left. :(

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture!!!  (sound is also very good)
Reviews.Author: M.W.
Reviews.Content: We've owned this for about 2 months now.  picture quality on HD movies is outstanding, sound is very good, easy to set up if you have a friend to help.  would definitely buy again.  love how you can see picture from almost anywhere in the room.  only downside is limited number of connections.  could not hook up all the other things we had hooked up to our old TV, but it worked out fine.  We moved the Wii downstairs and switch the cord back and forth between the regular xbox and the 360.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture for people who don't need top of the line home theater equipment.
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: After doing a lot of online research, I picked Panasonic because it's plasma screens consistently were rated highest quality image. I picked this particular model because it seemed to be the right balance of price and technology. It does have internet capabilities but only for Amazon Prime and Netflix and a handful of other pre-determined providers. However, we use a Roku 3 so I didn't need a lot of internet streaming capabilities. I thought for the price this is a great 50 inch TV with crisp theater quality picture and 1080HD. The sound is okay so you probably want to invest in speakers or a soundbar in addition to your TV. Ours seems too list a little to the L side on the base they provide. I'm not sure if other people have that same issue (most of the internal components seem to be on the left) but it's hardly detectable. I think 50 inches is rapidly becoming the lower limit of screen size but if you can afford a 60 in it would be nice depending on your space but the price point does go up dramatically (almost 100%). We have friends over regularly for movies and we're all please with the picture

Reviews.Title: Problems At Outset
Reviews.Author: Haydenks
Reviews.Content: The Bad News is:  I ordered my S60 from Amazon & it went on the blink six days after I set it up. Panasonic tech support had me describe the problem (no picture, three blinking lights) & sent a new board to the local appliance dealer. A week later, the repairman came out with the part & found it was not the right one for the problem!  Another week went buy & they came out again & installed the correct board.Now the Good News - the S60 has a great picture & was easy to setup. Unlike my Sony Home Theater, the internet was easy to set up & works flawlessly. With some more tech support from Panasonic, I was able to route my audio via my home theater to receive 5.1 sound!Regretfully, I just heard that Panasonic will be getting out of the Plasma tv business next year.  Hopefully, replacement parts will be available for years to come (if needed!).

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV that meets all that i need
Reviews.Author: jc
Reviews.Content: Outstanding TV that meets all that i need.  this was an upgrade to a 42 inch plasma that i had for a long time.  It allows me to connect to internet but not surf the net.  I can stream in HD all the movies i am willing to pay for.  Picture is perfect in a relatively well lit room with minimum reflections off the screen.

Reviews.Title: Amazing for the price
Reviews.Author: Saint Tardamus
Reviews.Content: We have had a lot of HD tvs.  We always lean towards the bargain side of the market, and this one is both a bargain and very, very good.I expected a great picture, but the smart features I didn't expect to work as well as they do.Can't go wrong.  Works great for gaming, for movies, for TV...on and on.

Reviews.Title: Great plasma tv with top notch picture, in a dimly lit room.
Reviews.Author: D. Woods
Reviews.Content: I love this tv, but i am not giving it five stars due to issue with reflection and washed out screen.  Has one of the best pictures on any tv in a dark room, but if you want this for a bright room you need to go with an LED/LCD or a higher end plasma.  I was also very impressed with the sound in this tv...unless you want a lot of bass and surround sound, it does the job.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Plasma HD TV
Reviews.Author: CPB "Retired Army"
Reviews.Content: Love this TV. It has phenomenal colors. Great for viewing sports. Panasonic makes the best plasma televisions and this one is one of their best. Great price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: L.J.
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price. If you arent looking for alot of frills, 3D, "smart" Tv get this Tv. Works best in dimly lit room. Awesome picture, hurts my eyes because HD is so brilliant and clear. Plenty of settings to suit your display preference, very user friendly!

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Liza Rockwood
Reviews.Content: Delivery was faster than expected (they will not install the base, so it will be left in the bottom half of the box), they plugged it in and test for power (nothing else).  We love the picture quality, but purchased a sound bar to improve it...big difference.  Very happy.

Reviews.Title: Great, I mean really great product.
Reviews.Author: Bruce Brunelle
Reviews.Content: This is second Panasonic Plasma tv I have owned. What can I say, it's a Panasonic. Nice with the small border frame. So much easier to set up now. Stunning picture! Concerned with the initial dark picture in a dark room, but a quick call to Panasonic solved the issue. Loveit! too bad it will be the last plasma they will make!

Reviews.Title: Perfect picture  No Audio-Out Connections
Reviews.Author: Heyduck
Reviews.Content: I purchased this 50" S60 for quicker/easier Netflix connection. This is my second Panasonic plasma and, once again, the picture is near perfect. The first plasma is simply going to the den for continued use.  The only complaint I have about both TVs is that there is no audio output connection.  This means I can watch a Netflix movie but can't use my surround system.  If anybody has any ideas I would love to hear them.

Reviews.Title: Best Value at 65inches
Reviews.Author: J. Bewley
Reviews.Content: If you're in the market for a large plasma, this is about as good as you can do at the moment.....keep in mind, I dont care about 3D, so that was a non-factor for me....this tv has an excellent picture, is relatively thin, and does have smart TV functions like Netflix and Amazon prime (though we have playstation and chromecast so it doesnt matter that much) I comparison shopped all over and still settled on this as the best value per inch.  If you're in the market for a large plasma, this is hard to beat

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRODUCT FOR THE PRICE
Reviews.Author: Lisa Davis
Reviews.Content: When this TV first arrived and we hooked it up -- I was less than impressed.  It took A LOT of tweaking on picture settings.  Once I got over the initial freak out because I thought the picture was always going to look like it did with the factory settings (which was HORRIBLE - apparently it's the "energy saver" setting)... I was quite happy.  We have a great TV (wish it did have Pandora on it... my only real wish now) and we didn't break the bank in purchasing it.  Just be prepared to tweak those picture settings before you make your judgment!  ;)

Reviews.Title: great picture, great tv for money
Reviews.Author: Wilson Alers
Reviews.Content: Although glare/reflection is an issue dependent on the lighting - if you're not obsessed with having zero glare, this TV's picture quality on sports, movies and normal everyday tv watching is head and shoulders above a LCD/LED at the same price point (I paid $650 in September 2013).I had no interest in 3d capabilities and although I didn't look for a smartTV, just having Netflix and youtube is a nice plus although for most people I am sure the smart features are lacking.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture
Reviews.Author: Randall G. Robinson
Reviews.Content: We enjoy the picture, and the built in Smart TV options. Only downside is the TV is a little slow transferring to different functions.

Reviews.Title: Excellent in dark rooms
Reviews.Author: DMG
Reviews.Content: The TV is beautiful in a low light room!  The TV is worth the price if you plan to put it in a theatre room. No 3D

Reviews.Title: Terrific TV!
Reviews.Author: L. Davidson
Reviews.Content: This is our first big, flat-screen TV and I love it! I though 50" would be too much, but it's not at all. The picture is great, even though we don't have HD service, and the Netflix button takes you right to your queue so you can watch your movies on the big screen. Nature shows are especially wonderful to watch. And for the price, you just can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: BEST PICTURE EVER
Reviews.Author: Martha Abraham
Reviews.Content: Stop looking for the best picture and take my word for it. We are amazed at the picture quality. Compare it at any price and you will not beat it. We are thrilled with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional.
Reviews.Author: husimon
Reviews.Content: Exceptional product, as all the TVs I've had from Panasonic have been.  Exceptional price and delivery from Amazon.This TV doesn't have every internet capability and is not 3D.  We have it in a rather dark room.  For us, all those things make for a much better value than one with more than we want or need.  The picture and sound are truly superior to anything else on the market except for perhaps the Panasonic VT or ST models

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Plasma only way to go!
Reviews.Author: boB
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for a 46" version of the same set. Which was broken by accident. This as good a TV as you will ever own. Plasma uses more electricity but is well worth it. The picture is beyound believe. Much better then other types of TVs. There was no question what to replace the 46" with. Also nice the way I can put my Sony cam movies on a usb drive and watch them in HD on the tv. We use a roku with it for Amaqzon Prime, The blaze, Acorn and a few freebees. Also put an ant up on the roof for about fifty local ant stations. Saving lots of $ after we dropped Directv. LOVE IT.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: CurtMan
Reviews.Content: My first flat screen! Old 36" CRT worked fine but after watching my cousin's HD for a week I needed a life improvement. This Panasonic Plasma is unbelievable for it's picture quality and features. I couldn't be more pleased. Amazon's delivery and install service was great and NO CHARGE. Buy your flat screen through Amazon, not one of the other re-sellers. You'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: Easily one of the best picture for 2013 plasmas
Reviews.Author: Mike P.
Reviews.Content: This Panny has an outstanding picture deep blacks, beautiful colors and a nice sharp clear picture! Can't believe this was less than a grand at 60". Easily one of the best bargains I have purchased. With very little tweaking this thing will put a big grin on your face!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Display
Reviews.Author: Billy gentry
Reviews.Content: 've got the TV hooked up to a PS3 for Netflix and Amazon Prime, as well as OTA Antenna.The picture on this thing is ridiculous. I've got it set in my back room, which is full of windows. For the most part, this isn't an issue, except when watching a darker movie/show. But, also for the most part, I'm watching in the evening. Windows are east, so, once again, for the most part it isn't an issue. I've had a 37" Visio LED back there for a couple of years, which is a decent enough TV. In my living room, I have a 60" Mitsu DLP, which I understand if I had it professionally calibrated, would also have a fantastic picture.It had arrived before the Cowboy (I know) Game Sunday night, so I was thrilled about that. High Def OTA is fantastic, by the way. Much better than the Satellite companies and my local Cable provider. Watching that, and now rewatching a few blurays, (Avatar, Fifth Element) have been a great pleasure. When I got my first Blu Ray Player, one of the first discs we purchased was Bram Stoker's Dracula with Gary Oldman and Anthony Hopkins. We've watched a couple of times over the years, and were really disappointed with it, as a lot of the scenes were too dark to make out even on my DLP in my very, very dark living room. So we tried it on the Plasma a couple of nights ago. First of all, the picture wasn't anything to write home about, as it seems that the just put the DVD master on a Bluray, if that makes sense. But aside from that, it did look very good, and we were able to truly enjoy the movie as we had remembered it in the theatre, years ago.Anyway, as soon as this puppy is paid off, I'm getting the 60" of 65" for the living room.RIDICULOUS!!

Reviews.Title: Good TV for Price
Reviews.Author: Joey
Reviews.Content: I'm by no means an expert, but I really like the TV. Picture quality is very good, I'd like it to be a little bit sharper. My friend got one of the upgraded versions of this TV with Smart and 3D and it seems to have the better picture quality over all, but the comparisons not apples to apples (not in the same house when viewing). Overall I'm very happy, for the price I don't think I could have done much better

Reviews.Title: Just what i need
Reviews.Author: lobatt
Reviews.Content: Forget about 3D, Smart TV, blahblah...I just need a big 1080p HD screen to work with my Chromecast/Apple TV/Roku/you name it....And it has built in WIFI(I am looking at you, LG), with WPS, I connected it to my wireless router with just 2 click.Although I believe that any built-in smart stuff are just junk that cost you more, it is nice that it has Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, Hulu plus, Youtube built in with 1 click on the internet button, without adding much to it price. The operation is less smooth compares to streaming boxes, but with only 1 remote, I can just watch what i want from the internet, that is convenient.Also the graphic quality is great in my dark living room.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture!
Reviews.Author: Aaron K. Alldaffer
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for about a month now and have to say I really enjoy it. I had a LED before this one and I have always liked the plasma look better. The initial setup of the tv is very easy and connection to your WI-FI is also simple. I don't use any of the smart apps because I have a Playstation. The apps seem simple to use and perfect for a bare bone smart tv. Blu-Rays looks amazing on this TV have to say this is one of the best looking TV's I have seen in a long time. Everything is crisp and colors are bright. The only problem I have is the blacks. The black are very strong, sometimes to strong. If I change the brightness or try and make the colors brighter it becomes to saturated and loses its good picture. I have it set to my best ability at a good balance, just wish the blacks could be handled easier. Netflix also looks really good but you can see some distortion once the internet buffers the video or it catches up. Video games is where this TV surpasses others. There is noticeable lag when playing online games or regular games. Everything is very responsive and PC's look really good playing through this TV. If you are looking for a good size TV for games I would definitely recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Hussein
Reviews.Content: The quality of the picture and the options available on the tv are phenomenal. The quality I got for the price I paid is incomparable. One of my all-time favorite amazon purchases.

Reviews.Title: The best TV I've ever owned.
Reviews.Author: Steven Hallmark "Human"
Reviews.Content: This TV provides a beautiful picture, easy operation, basic smart TV functionality, and a handsome slim profile. I have had zero issues with any aspect of this TV's performance. I have owned several other HDTVs, including LCDs, LEDS, and other Plasmas, and this Panasonic display is head and shoulders above any of them. There is no noticeable ghosting, motion blur, zero short term image burn in, deep blacks and vibrant colors. I only have one issue with this TV...2 HDMI inputs. Other than that, it's flawless.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: d.hamen
Reviews.Content: We are finishing our basement and we decided to move our old 56" DLP downstairs for TV and gaming. We are also putting built-ins around our fireplace so we needed a TV to mount over the fireplace. I did a lot of research and read a ton of reviews on TVs in the 47"-50" range. I didn't want to spend a lot on a TV and I want the best bang for my buck. This TV is amazing. Great quality picture, brightness is spot on, and because of the location the TV is in the reflections aren't that big of a deal to me. I pondered going to Costco to get the AR version, but I think I made the right choice. I wanted a Plasma for sports and gaming because of the refresh rate, and I wasn't disappointed. I'm not a TV expert, I'm sure this TV has it flaws, but I am nothing but impressed so far.The company used to deliver the TV was far less desirable. The TV was set to be delivered last Friday but the local delivery company did not have it that way. I called the HQ and the lady on the phone helped get me connected to the local store. They ended up having to deliver the TV the next day. When they showed up and older lady and young man got out of the van and the lady asked me to help unload the TV and get it in the house.Then I had to unbox the TV and set it up. I thought the delivery companies were supposed to set it up and make sure it works, but the lady kept saying no. Not a fan of this company at all!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: So far this TV is working great.  We were advised to get a plasma TV by someone who knows, and we're glad we did.  The picture is sharp and colors are good.  We don't seem to be bothered by the reflection on the screen, which some other reviewers mentioned.

Reviews.Title: No issues with this TV
Reviews.Author: Bruha48073
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived quickly. Great price, no shipping charges and the delivery crew set it up and turned it on to make sure it was working for free. Some reviews have complained about the reflection. Yes, there is some reflection but I don't consider it any worse than others TV's I've seen in stores. I adjusted the settings to some that I found online and the picture is crystal clear viewing with Blu-ray.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic buy
Reviews.Author: Mike Kanavos
Reviews.Content: Fantastic set!  Go to cnet for "optimal" picture settings - and do be careful re: a very bright room.....But if you can keep a room relatively dark - this set can't be beat for the $$$

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture and quality!
Reviews.Author: SM23
Reviews.Content: I researched the best 60" flat screen & after reading reviews for this one, I must agree that it's a wonderful TV!  Great picture, sound, and quality....I'd highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: quality TV
Reviews.Author: Ross
Reviews.Content: Great TV quality for the price. Not a better deal out there for the quality of TV like this 1

Reviews.Title: Great service
Reviews.Author: Timo  Wadhawan "TimoV"
Reviews.Content: Works well have all the features I need. Recommend it highly, price too. My last TV lasted 12 years. Expect this to last 5+ before I get a 4K.

Reviews.Title: A lot of TV for a low price
Reviews.Author: Ellen Cohen
Reviews.Content: Picture great.  A lot of TV for a low price.  One of the best televisions we own.  Panasonic is excellent

Reviews.Title: 600 hz plasma tv
Reviews.Author: Thomas M O'Brien
Reviews.Content: everything is great except it needs one more hdmi port for the sound bar thats all i got to say.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: sally durham
Reviews.Content: very nice tv we bought it for our bonus room and i love the picture quality the sound is good  and loved the price protection from amazon

Reviews.Title: Great quality HD plasma at a great price
Reviews.Author: Rafael J Diaz-Garcia
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with my purchase.  I shopped around and this was by far the best price for the TV.  Delivery was quick and the well-packed.  Would recommend to anyone looking for an entry level plasma price but mid-range quality.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Cajun Boy
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture and even the sound is OK.  The price was outstanding and with free shipping it is a great buy.  It arrived in excellent shape and the delivery person set it up very quickly.  ...a great TV!

Reviews.Title: Wow what a TV
Reviews.Author: Georgia Man "Georgia Man"
Reviews.Content: Ex wife wanted a new tv for her new house. Now hanging on the wall over the fireplace. Great from all angles. Wireless if you need it. Great picture and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Exceeds expectations
Reviews.Author: Will Earnest "Will"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a large(r) screen TV for the lower level where we have the room to enjoy one (on the main level, constrained by furniture).  I didn't need "smart TV" and it seemed many implementations weren't that good in any case.My natural tendency was to another brand which I've had good luck with.  However, after some research (and Amazon's guides) I looked at plasmas in addition to the LCD/LED's.  I went to a local retailer (big box) to see what the various models looked like and ended up with the S60 (not ST60) as an open box item - hence a good price.  The alternative was a Samsung but I thought maybe I needed a change if only to preclude crosstalk.In any case, so far at least, this TV has proved to be an excellent choice.  There's no problem with lighting (and reflections) on this level (mostly overhead if on) and on the "Home Theater" setting it's pretty close to perfect.  I hadn't realized how much difference there is in color between this type of TV and the LCD/LED's.  The color is rich, with flesh tones that look real for example.
