I've gone back to some DVD's that I've used on other TV's and it's noticeable closer to how I remember seeing them at a theater.  So +1 for color fidelity and presentation as intended.We have (enough) capacity for Netflix, Amazon and Hulu.  With this TV, the Netflix button makes it pretty easy to access.  Very slick.  On this model not a lot of extra apps but if I wanted, there's another HDMI port if one wants to explore (I have PS3 attached as well).  Setup is super simple, and works (for me) first time.  The setup (via menu button) is very simple - much better than the last time I set one up (a few years make a difference).  I downloaded Viera2Remote on my tablet - also works seamlessly.  The swipe/swap from the tablet allows very easy slide shows (haven't taken the time to figure out how to change the default music yet).  +1 for easy connectivity.  I've yet to try DLNA - it appears there's a temporary problem with Plex that I use with a Roku box (also an excellent product).All in all, very pleased.  Very simple to set up, works as expected with little extra effort.  Great color.  Actually a great price (I think) given comparable models.  It's early yet so I may find something later on but for now, simply enjoying it.  It seemed that the big box was closing these out even though this set was built in April.  Shows you how fast this market moves.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: Killa McGrill
Reviews.Content: Amazon really came through for me on this purchase.  I tried to save $50 and order this from some New York based reseller, but shipping was 10 days out and they added $100 insurance charge on my "free" delivery.  Canceled the sale when they tried to sell me $80 HDMI cables.  Amazon's purchase experience was just the opposite.  Free delivery and the guy even plugged it in and tested the remote.  Color and picture quality are supreme.  Inky blacks.  Built in Netflix button on the remote is so easy that my 5 year can use it.  Thumbs up all around.

Reviews.Title: Awesome.
Reviews.Author: Justin A
Reviews.Content: I have a media room where I can limit ambient light to zero, and a tv mount that allows me to angle the screen away from any glares if I choose to leave lights on or windows open. But seriously, for the price, I love this tv.  Picture is incredible. I would still be wary of putting it in a very bright location. For correct plasma tv locations though, no need to get a more expensive tv.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Good price
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace a 2010 model Panasonic plasma that my toddler broke.This one is practically half the cost of the one it replaced, and the picture is every bit as good. Everything works as intended, and I'm satisfied with the purchase. I'm using wired internet with this, which works well. I can't comment on WiFi connectivity.

Reviews.Title: Nothing short of incredible!
Reviews.Author: PaleRider
Reviews.Content: This set replaced my Panasonic 50" Plasma  HDTV that was damaged by an electrical surge during a thunderstorm. That 50" Plasma  was awesome, and this 60" Plasma takes that awesome and makes it even better with the increased viewing size. This set has built in wireless as well, perfect for firmware updates, etc. If you want the best picture, get Plasma --- you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: .tv
Reviews.Author: vinnycaz
Reviews.Content: great plasma , had one prior to this was not nearly as good great color and very sharp, good options on this one and its easy to work no brainer great product. ready for some football

Reviews.Title: Panasonic TC-P50S60
Reviews.Author: Shaun
Reviews.Content: I bought the Panasonic through Amazon.  I know they back their products so I felt very good ordering through them.  CEVA delivered it.  They moved my old TV out of the way for me and put together my new one.  Turned it on and made sure it was ok. They did a great job.  The Plasma has great color to it.  There is some reflection on the screen, from light sources.  I can live with it, but it might bother some people.  If I had seen that in person I might have gone with an LED or LCD.  They don't show it as much.  I was worried that a 50" screen size might be too big.  It isn't.  I was going to get a 42" but they sold out.  This was the same price or less.  I believe I paid $699.99 including shipping.  Seems like a great deal to me.  I also researched and the Panasonic plasmas were getting some of the best ratings.  I am happy with it so far.  It did have a snapping or cracking sound.  Panasonic sent out a repairman to check it out.  He tightened some loose screws. Said that another one had the same problem.  So no big deal.  I would recommend it to anyone for the price and picture quality.  No blurs with fast action.  Just the reflection that may bother some people.  I am glad to have it.

Reviews.Title: Great Plazma 65" TV
Reviews.Author: mike zowie
Reviews.Content: Great Plazma TV  and panasonic is one of the best for plazma  fits my living room and got shipped very quickly.  Great BUY

Reviews.Title: So far LOVE it!
Reviews.Author: S. Otradovsky "healthy mama"
Reviews.Content: Got this from some other store, but it was between this and a Vizio 50-inch E500I-A1. I visted a big box store to compare the two and decided on this because it would be in the basement entertainment area where there were no windows nearby (plasma tv). The sound and picture quality is amazing and I like the internet feature where you can go to netflix, hulu plus, amazon and youtube. For youtube stuff, you can pair your device w/the tv and play trailers, movies, etc. Currently have it paired w/iphone4 and nook color/android side. Got a google app for the panasonic tv so I can keyboard searches for youtube internet or whenever I need to use a keyboard. I'm still exploring all the possibilities with it. Super-easy set-up w/wifi. Right now I'd rather stay home and play with the TV than go to work. That sad or what? lol! One thing I need to do is get a code so I can operate the TV using my Dish remote.  Codes can be found on the Dish site. We'll see how well that works. I didn't want to spend a million dollars on a TV, but wanted the best value for the best price and believe I got it. We'll see later if I'm still satisfied with it. That's why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. It's only Day 2.10/2013: On the internet side of the TV, on youtube, I was able to pair it with my tablet (Nook color with android added), my son was able to pair with Iphone5 and I was able to pair it with my laptop (Lenovo IdeaPad). However sometimes it didn't work well with my laptop, unsure why. Also you can get a remote control app on Google Play. It's still a nice TV. Wish all the other TV's in our house were smart tv's as well. Oh and the Tilted Kilt in our city uses this TV all over their restaurant.

Reviews.Title: Best Picture Quality Ever!
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: This is one awesome tv. Picture quality is beyond fantastic. Sound is lacking a bit. But I already have a killer sound bar. Why Panasonic is getting out of the Plasma TV Biz Is beyond me. I HIGHLY recommend this set.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture quality
Reviews.Author: Lisa Chapman "RNC"
Reviews.Content: My old tube (Sony tritron) finally died so I went out and replaced it with an LED TV. I purchased a Vizio that got stellar reviews. Took it home and instantly was disappointed. Everything was blurry and way to white washed. I did some further research and discovered that Plasma was the way to go. I was concerned that my bright room was to well lit for a plasma but I went for it anyway. I was able to get the Costco version with the anti-glare screen ($500). This TV is amazing. I applied some setting recommendations I found and now that the TV has properly warmed up over 100 hours, it looks superb. I do not even have a bluray player yet and I'm already blown away by the picture quality. Love this TV. The apps work fine but its not why I got the TV, any DVD player will do the same. If your looking for a budget quality screen, this is an excellent choice. The only think I would say I do not love is that bright white screens look more like a muted white and there is a hum from the screen when it is mostly white. The hum is super low and almost ignorable when the TV is at normal volumes.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with TV performance
Reviews.Author: Douglas G. Smith
Reviews.Content: Once I had the cable-control issue resolved, the set-up and subsequent use has been pleasing.  Apparently the remote control can't  be used with the cable connection and one must use the far more rudimentary control furnished by the cable supplier.  I'm concerned that switching back and forth between cable and other inputs may present complexities that could render the television unusable without additional assistance.  As long as the TV is used as a cable connected receiver, I suspect we'll continue to be pleased with the performance.

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong with a Panasonic - but you do get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Olozbal
Reviews.Content: Had this model about 2 weeks now and it's a great TV for the price.  I previously had the top of the line Samsung 64" 3D plasma a few years ago until my 7 year old decided to introduce the Wii remote to it.  We recently moved and I decided to give it another shot.  I realized with the Samsung all those whiz bang features were useless to me and the 3D was something we put on once for people to look at then everyone got bored.  So this time I went with the low frills Panasonic 65" plasma and for the price this is a nice TV.Two things to highlight - the first delivery we unboxed it while the delivery guy was still here.....screen was smashed.  Since he was still here we just had him pick it back up and return it.  Called Amazon and they shipped another one no questions asked.  Lesson here - don't let the delivery guy get away until you know you have a good TV.  Note my Samsung a few years ago came the same way.  I can't imagine how many TV's get lost this way.Also, this is a low frills TV and the picture is nice for sure, but we did have the top Cnet rated TV for a while and it is pretty noticable.  20/20 hindsight I'd probably have thrown down a few more hundred bucks and gotten a midrange Panasonic plasma but overall I'm happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy if you like hockey...Great otherwise...
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: For everything else this TV has been great, vivid picture, football, movies, regular TV, even in my tv room with windows. There is a lot of glare/reflections on the TV, you need to be careful where you place it. If you sit directly in front of it, you'll see yourself(and all your other crap) in any scenes with dark colors...However if you watch any hockey the ice is greyish colored and the screen is really dark. You can try tweaking all the color settings, turn of power saving mode but none of them will help. The odd thing is, when your adjusting the colors/settings the picture looks perfect, but once you exit settings and the white ICE is shown on the screen the power saving kicks in and darkens everything(even with no light in room it's too dark). This is not a brightness issue, rather power saving issue, when screen is filled with anything supposed to be white this happens the screen will darken...Good thing I saved the box, it'll be going back... :(Update...I've kept the TV, picture is great, I spent a few days messing around with all the settings, trying to improve the hockey ICE picture. I ended up calling support, they walked me thru a few settings, that didn't seem to make much difference at the time. I think either I've gotten used to it, the TV has "burned" in a little more, and I've noticed it really depends on where the Hawks are playing has the biggest impact. There is a difference in the picture coming from my really bight DLP and I think it's just the adjustment.... :)

Reviews.Title: HDMI port doesnt work
Reviews.Author: Thao Mac
Reviews.Content: I connect my HD Box or XBox 360 to the TV via HDMI port , the screen just have message "No signal. Ensure that the external device is turned on and property connected to the TV's input". I kept trying to turn off and on the external device, change another HDMI cable and it still doesnt work. I have to get it fixed at expert's place. Just used it for about 1 week

Reviews.Title: Love it, love it, love it!!!
Reviews.Author: calgal
Reviews.Content: This is the best TV I have every owned! The picture is phenomenal - even after a few months, I still marvel at how beautiful the colors are and how clear the picture is. All the TV features work great, as well as the remote. I highly recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: A Fine TV.
Reviews.Author: Richard B. Herold
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv in december, after learning about improvements in plasma technology and wanting a tv with solid blacks on a budget.7 months later im happy to report that it performs perfectly. Great image, slim enough design (bezel and width) and viera connect make it so that i do not think about this tv anymore and can focus on whats on it: which is the highest compliment you can give for a tv.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Nevits
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Mother-in-Law and she happy with it. For the price, it's a great TV. I'd buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Pretty nice picture!
Reviews.Author: J. East "Music coniseur"
Reviews.Content: So, after many hours of research and more hours at local retailers (Sam's and Costco included), I couldn't find a better "bang for your buck" deal. I made my girlfriend more than slightly annoyed with my fervent search by the way. LOLBut nonetheless, this is the best TV for the price ($699 @ Best Buy). I had returned plasma's twice previously over the past 8 years but this one's a keeper. I had a 55" Vizio Razor LED Smart/3D that I had bought 2 weeks prior and returned it as I was getting more in product reliability with the Panasonic. Plus, they own all the original tech stuff from Pioneer who perfected plasma technology. So there you have it. Of course, what looks best to you may not be what looks best to me.

Reviews.Title: nice picture, easy set up
Reviews.Author: Palomo "Palomo"
Reviews.Content: ordered the Panasonic tc-p50s60 through Amazon, they had the best price.  Delivery was through CEVA shipping and they emailed to set up a delivery appointment.The delivery people offered to set the tv up.Hook up was a breeze and the set up menu was relatively simple, though I do own a couple other Panasonic tv's so I am familiar with the menu's, etc. I was able to sync up the TV to my wireless which is nice since it automatically set up the time.The picture is clear,easy to navigate.Over all very pleased with this tv especially in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Huge Step Up!
Reviews.Author: R. Parsons
Reviews.Content: Ok, I must first confess that I bought the TV off of another website instead of Amazon; who I typically get my TVs from. The other site had the TC-P60S60 for $1099 delivered and no tax. Can't beat that price, so hoping Amazon gives it their best shot to come down a little.But onto the TV. First off, I have a lot of TVs, and they are ALL Panasonic Plasma's. (save for the glare issue, these TVs really can't be beat)So, I have a TC-P55GT30, and a TC-P65ST50, and a TC-P60U50. I read up on this TV and it has been mentioned in a number of professional reviews that the TC-P60S60 has better picture than the TC-P60VT50. Considering that the P60VT50 is still about $2500 today, it makes the TC-P60S60 a no-brainer.And boy what a difference! First off, this TV SMOKES all my other TVs. The picture (I calibrated it to CNET spec) is incredible, and even without calibration (just put it into Cinema Mode) I was blown away while running through a selection of HD Amazon movies. (I love to use Rango for testing). The contrast is insane and there are times when the light just pops right off the screen.As an added quirk, Panasonic has updated their Viera Menu, and it is very clean and simple to use (way better than my ST50). The profile while looking at the TV directly from the side -- when are you really ever doing this -- is actually deeper than all my other TVs. But the bezel around the screen is actually thinner and cleaner than the older models (it looks professional). I'm thinking the slightly larger depth measurement is why Panasonic was able to keep the price on this TV so low.In the end - I can't believe how good this TV set is, and I do plan on buying another once Amazon brings down their price a bit.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Jazzfan
Reviews.Content: I have the top of the Panasonic plasma TV from 2008 and can tell you this screen has a much brighter picture than my older one. Very satisfied with this new one, although the screen is pretty reflective. I was raised on tube TVs so I'm used to a reflective screen. The price is great, the picture is great, what more can you ask for. Oh, I wasn't sure how the silver trim would look, but it's tastefully done and actually looks pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Great TV with one issue
Reviews.Author: HandymanJD
Reviews.Content: We bought the non-internet version of this TV in August of 2011.  On Friday it lost power to a 2 inch wide pixel band right down the middle.  Yep, big black band.  Luckily we'd bought the extended warranty.  We were able to upgrade, since the prices have gone down, and chose the same tv, stepping up to the WiFi version.  Why?  The picture quality is incredible.  The menu's are also easier than ever to use.There are other reviews here with more detail on what the tv has to offer, so I won't repeat all that.  Suffice it to say we had a choice and bought another one just like the first one.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: NBJohn
Reviews.Content: Had it for a month now. Picture is great, built in internet apps work excellent, no complains whatsoever about this TV. The glare, even in my well it living room, is pretty minimal. It's there if you're super picky about it, but it doesn't interfere with my TV watching.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: wrkrbeee
Reviews.Content: Shipped in a very durable box with significant cushioning.  Very easy to set up, great picture! Would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Picture for a Good Price
Reviews.Author: J. Wallace "Zerb"
Reviews.Content: PROS* Incredible picture quality after proper calibration (see [...]* Good streaming (Netflix, Amazon, etc.) from the built-in wireless support; excellent streaming when you connect an Ethernet cableCONS* Although new plasma units don't have the burn-in/image retention problems they once had, you may want to be careful to avoid static images during the first 300 hours of use* Internal speaker lacks dynamic range* Only has three HDMI inputs

Reviews.Title: lacks an IR input so looses a star
Reviews.Author: J & M's mom
Reviews.Content: We want a soundbar to improve the movie-watching experience, but unfortunately (for our setup) a sound bar will block the TV's remote sensor on the bottom frame of the TV.  The TV does NOT have an IR input so we can't buy an IR receiver extender "eye" to put elsewhere on the frame.  DARN!!

Reviews.Title: Almost Great
Reviews.Author: Raymond Fung
Reviews.Content: This tv is almost great and would be deserving of 5 stars if it weren't for the very grayish whites, especially when most of the screen is white, this is even in a dim room.  There is just not enough dynamic range in the picture.  Otherwise the picture quality is stunning with vibrant colors and good skin tones at the same time, deep blacks, and a velvety smooth image.

Reviews.Title: Best TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Grey Bull
Reviews.Content: If all you're after is a great picture, this is the best value I've found.  It's only the 3D it lacks - I don't watch enough 3d to justify twice the money.  Maybe it should get 5 stars but from a true videophile standpoint, the more expensive Panasonics beat it (barely)

Reviews.Title: How Do You Use This Thing?
Reviews.Author: Joseph Giordano
Reviews.Content: On the one hand, this is the best TV I have ever had.  On the other hand I'm upgrading from a giant 1990's era projection screen so I lack savvy. Beautiful set.  The darks are too dark so I cranked the brightness way up, but I don't really know how to use those settings and the instructions are useless.  There is substantial glare when the lights are on, but that's apparently normal for plasma.  Awesome tv, unfortunately the actual tv shows are terrible.  Two Broke Girls????? America's Top Model???? Maybe I should read more.

Reviews.Title: Great price for a great TV
Reviews.Author: latemom2000
Reviews.Content: Although plasma is probably on its way out this TV was perfect for the room we were putting it in (low light).  Beautiful picture and nice smart TV features.  More HDMI and component hook-ups would be nice.

Reviews.Title: Great deal! Excellent service!
Reviews.Author: Eli
Reviews.Content: What a great deal and everything promised by vendor was top notch! I would buy again. Amazing picture quality and sharpness. Best TV for the money!

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Jarred Welborn
Reviews.Content: Great resolution.  Great picture, easy set up.  cant wait til football season cant believe what a great price this was

Reviews.Title: Initial Impression Of The Panasonic 50" S60 Plazma Television
Reviews.Author: Alvin Ferguson "beastly1"
Reviews.Content: I've had the S60 for a week now and I'm really impressed by it!  This television is situated in my bedroom that is hung on my wall with a soundbar as it replaces a Samsung 32 incher.The blacks and color detail are impressive to say the least and the built in aps are sufficient enough for me.My next planned purchase is one of the VT60 series that will be situated in the living room but I must say these Panasonic plazmas are a great value especially the S60 series.I highly recommend the S60 as an excellent all around TV especially for bedroom viewing.Update: 8/20/2013:The S60 is still great but I wanted to provide an update about my future purchase of one of the VT60 series plasmas.  Initially, I had stated that my next purchase was going to be the one of the VT60 series in Panasonic's line.  However, I bought the 60" ZT60 instead and it is a marvelous piece of technology!  It is simply reference quality!  My ZT60 was not bought on Amazon because I bought it from another store at an absolutely fantastic price.

Reviews.Title: Incredible TV
Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: Some highlights...controlling the TV from my smart phone, watching You Tube from my iPad, incredible picture, seamless connectivity with my Panasonic Home Theater system...what an amazing TV!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: John R. Blasius
Reviews.Content: The quality is as expected and overall, the value is excellent.  It may be "last year's model", and there may be newer, better pictures, but you will pay considerably more for features I don't need and wouldn't use.

Reviews.Title: Great price, great plasma TV, with some smart tv features.
Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: I own 3 Panasonic TV in my house VT30, DT30, and now S60. The S60 is the cheapest TV, but picture quality is about the same. If you don't care about 3D, smart TV features, or a lot of HDMI ports, than this TV is perfect for you.Pro: Cheap, Great picture/sound quality, Built-in Wi-Fi, Remote control.Con: Only 2 HDMI ports.$699 for this 2013 TV is a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Not cool Panasonic
Reviews.Author: Dillard Roosevelt
Reviews.Content: The TV itself looked great for all of 1 hour before it shut itself off and started blinking the power light 3 times. After trying to disconnect the digital antenna and trying different electrical outlets, per instructions from Panasonic's support line, it still wasn't fixed and they said it would take a minimum of a week before a tech could come replace the part that needed to be replaced.Amazon was great about allowing a return and scheduling a pickup, but made me severely question Panasonic's reliability.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely awesome, but...
Reviews.Author: krees
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is outstanding,Sexy thin bezel, Media center feature is great, Bright room performance is ok, Glare from shiny screenAND after 2 different TVs from Amazon, they both make this noticeable buzzing noise when powered on.  Come from the actual screen and not the speakers.  Seems to fluctuate depending on the picture being shown.  Noticeable in quiet scenes or low volume.  I will try to get the warranty to take care of this.

Reviews.Title: TWENTY DOLLARS LESS THIS WEEK THAN LAST?
Reviews.Author: Bax
Reviews.Content: The good news Thursday afternoon was that my TC-50S60 had arrived at JAX airport; the bad news is that Pilot Freight didn't have a truck coming to my island until next Wednesday - but I could drive to JAX and pick it up myself, the lady said. After seeing the Gamecocks hammer my Tar Heels at a bar Thursday evening, and knowing I would suffer dire consequences if I missed opening weekend of the college season and probably depression, as well, if I went another several more days without Pandora, I cranked up the old Tacoma early Friday, threw Ben Rothelisberger, my Boston, into the back, and left at 0500 for the airport. Two burly guys were waiting on me at Pliot's place, and loaded me immediately, laying the TV on its side - face down. The box said it weighed 66.6 lbs. When I got back to my island cabin, I backed the Tacoma up to the outside stairs and thought, how am I going to get this big babe up to my second floor man-cave without help? Hey, no problem - just lift it by its "box handles," and proceed only about 3-4 steps at a time.  Piece of cake, and even at 92 in the shade, I was up the stairs and inside in a jiff.Everything from there was cake....  Base assembly is only 7  larger screws and 4 smaller screws (use your magnetic phillips for alignment ease, or a magnetic drill bit, but not the drill). Machined holes aligned perfectly, and if not, chances are you need to turn the base "neck" 180 degrees, as you've got it backwards.  Base is heavy steel, machined beautifully, and is finished in black, which you DO NOT want to scratch. Use rubber surgical gloves, and tighten the screws only fingertight.  That's plenty tight.  Twenty minutes later I had the base installed and lifted up easily to the top of my receiver cabinet.  Hooked up the power cable, HDMI cables from my receiver and bluetooth, installed included batteries in the remote, and clicked the unit on.  No problem, and after loading clicked input on left side of panel, moved to HDMI on screen, clicked, and began uploading DirctTV, as I had been on vacation in Idaho for a couple of months breathing smoke.Perfect plasma picture and surround sound - far better than I've had previously with LEDs - appeared almost immediately for me to questions asked by Panasonic.  Only pic adjustment I made was to try and handle the shock of the Oregon Ducks in all white - and back and forth all night - had a perfect pic also for Alabama, then Ga. v. Clemson., all of which I taped on DirectTV's DVR-receiver - GOD BLESS DIRECT TV - and, tonight my girl friend comes over for the Downton Abbey and Foyle's War specials on PBS.  Direct TV remote programmed to operate TV on first try, and connecting to my NETGEAR 90 network was simple and immediate, once I understood password had to be in lower case letters.  PANDORA is now all over my place... and tonight we tap into AMAZON's PRIME library, as well, for no cost movies that I haven't seen.  This Panasonic Plasma is programed for that, which was an added snd very pleasant surprise for me.This Panasonic plasma - first one I've had - is 5-Star, and I'm gonna wallmount it next week before Gators v. Miami suresure. I just don't understand why it's $20 bucks cheaper than when I bought it.  Were it me, I would have raised the price, not lowered it.  And, no shipping cost for PRIME members, either....  J.Bezos rocks!

Reviews.Title: Just spend the extra for the ST60
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: Bought this and returned it for the ST.Picture was great but had too much of a buzz for me.  A bit of banding in the screen and black levels were adequate, but the ST looks 100 times better.

Reviews.Title: Great so far...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Purchaser 2010
Reviews.Content: We haven't had the tv for very long, but so far so good. I like the screen formatting functionality and the pseudo-Internet capabilities (we've got prime and that interface works very well). I would like to see the ability to cuatomize the "apps" though. We have the tv mounted on the wall in a bright room, but the screen clarity/brightness overcomes this.

Reviews.Title: wow
Reviews.Author: Ronnie Hotz
Reviews.Content: Best plasma for the money.  It blows away any led I've seen.  I love it.  The picture is captivating.  Settle for nothing less!

Reviews.Title: Great set for the money
Reviews.Author: Wordsmyth "Peter"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Easy to set up and use, excellent picture and decent sound. The smart features are terrific - I cancelled my cable TV subscription and the money I'm saving will pay for the TV in less than a year. I'm using a run of the mill router to stream and haven't noticed any problems, though I did upgrade my internet connection to 50 mbps download speed.Cons: Picture is a little too dim in daylight, but my living room gets lots of light and I knew that going in, since it's a plasma set. I think the (very) slightly higher power usage compared to LED units is not a consideration overall unless you're fanatic about conservation.

Reviews.Title: Decent enough plasma
Reviews.Author: Roc
Reviews.Content: Got this from Amazon; shipping and set up was a breeze. The color was great after calibration, perfect for media content, but not very good as a monitor (LEDs are better). I am very satisfied with the sound; and the form factor is very attractive. The glossy screen is quite reflective so you'd better not use it in a bright room. Panasonic plasmas are gradually out of the market, so I am glad that I picked this up.

Reviews.Title: TC-P65S60 Review
Reviews.Author: Nate
Reviews.Content: This product from Amazon exceeded my expectations.  It arrived on schedule with the driver delivering it inside the house and leaving it wherever I wanted it.  It was packed in a box that allowed for a safe trip from point A to point B.  I would order another one if I ever needed another TV!

Reviews.Title: Seven blinks of death 4 months after we received
Reviews.Author: S. Pisani
Reviews.Content: Do not buy!!! After only 4 months, and we barely watch tv the tv is broke, 7 blinks of death does not come on we have to unplug for hours before it works again - no fix availableRead all the other reviews!!!

Reviews.Title: Totally bummed...
Reviews.Author: TK
Reviews.Content: The picture is terrible and whatever I do to it makes it worse. I was going to buy a more expensive and better rated television. Now I wish I did not look at the reviews on here and went with my instincts. I am totally bummed!! At least Amazon makes it easy to return which is why I use Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: JohnH6161
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this appears to be a common issue developing with these Panasonic sets i.e the '7 blinks of death'! Several customers are complaining about it. The problem is caused by one, both, or all of the following boards: SC board, SD board, and SU board. Most commonly, the SC board is the one that has failed and because Panasonic have received so many complaints about this issue.I am growing tired of no reply, no call back or if a call goes thru care rep only leaves 5-6 second message that is cut short with no information off v-mail message. Heard multiple time that my emails and faxes a have not been received by Panasonic even though fax receipt shows successful transmission.Repair costSS BOARD $178.49SC BOARD $182.33CHEMICALS & MATERIALs $18.50TAX $22.76LABOR $190.00TOTAL ESTIMATE $592.08

Reviews.Title: Mirror mirror on the wall...
Reviews.Author: J Wall
Reviews.Content: Bought this in the 60" version from a local big box retailer because it was out of stock on Amazon to replace a 5 year old 50" Samsung plasma. Having had a plasma before, I was not concerned with the glare I saw in the store, as the store had tons of light overhead and coming in through the windows...Boy was I mistaken! This S60 is a MIRROR on the wall! I could see color reflections in any dark areas of the screen that I had never experienced with the Samsung. I do not have a lot of direct light coming in the windows. Reflections could be seen even with the drapes closed and one small lamp on. ANY light in the room turns this S60 into a glorious mirror and washes the screen out. Luckily, the big box had a 30 day no hassle return policy. After packing this beast back up in the original packaging and securing it in the bed of the pickup, we began the journey again. This time we went for the BIG one! Purchased the 65" ST60 with only 7 left on Amazon and free enhanced delivery. Wow! What a difference! The ST60 is everything you read on CNET and more! The ST60 has a bonded anti-reflective coating. Reflections are minimal, you have to look hard to see any even with all windows open and lights on. The picture quality is amazing! Color is consistent, does not wash out like the S60. Save yourself time and buy the ST60 and get enhanced delivery. The delivery was smooth. They scheduled a three hour delivery window, called before they arrived and hung the tv on my existing wall mount. Exceptional service! Thanks Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Still has heat issues
Reviews.Author: VS
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv in June 2013...i was so nervous about buying a plasma and not an LED...which is what everyone is buying. I did months of research and a friend suggested that I buy the plasma. "More for the money" he convinced me. He had the 2012 version and he said it worked great so I went ahead and bought this 50" for $999. When i got the tv and we opened the box, with my luck, I expected it to be broken, but it came in the original box in great condition. The set up was very simple and it looked stunning...the size as well as the picture. After having it on for several hours I was uncomfortable with the amount of heat it generated. I asked my friend who has the 2012 version of the Panasonic if his tv gave off as much heat and he said he cant touch his tv if its been on for 8 or more hours. The heat issues with his version is tremendous!!! Now he did tell me the heat is a problem and that the newer version is much much cooler but he didn't tell me its still a problem...I don't game but hours of watching can be a problem. I ended up having to keep a fan on the tv when it in use for several hours...i am still fearful that it would overheat and just blow up. Other than the heat, the only other problems I experienced was that the Seagate external drive that I bought for it just did not work...it worked on the computer and on the LG but not on the Panasonic. I ended up having to exchange the new Seagate for a used WD Passport and it worked fine. Comparison: Last month my sister bought the LG 47LA4700 and after setting up the LG we compared the difference with the plasma and the LED...it was obvious who was the winner...the LG. The screen was like liquid so clean and clear. There was absolutely NO heat issues and the pointer mouse remote is the bomb!!! I love that you can use the mouse to click on the screen. It made my dumb remote seem like a 1960s version. I really hate that about my Panasonic...its like comparing an android phone to a blackberry 9300...it sucks. What I did not like about the LG is the tv stand. With kids I feel like it would just topple over. The Panasonic has a sturdy flat base. All in all i did get what I paid for which was size as opposed to functionality. Honestly if there was some way I could get a pointer remote for my Panasonic I would gladly buy it...Don't get me wrong I really like my tv but i hope that plasma people work on the issues customers are having and take note for the next version maybe I would still buy a plasma in the next ten years if they keep on improving...who knows.

Reviews.Title: Picture Quality
Reviews.Author: J. Smith
Reviews.Content: Disagree with Cnet.com's comments on the picture quality being the best. Maybe if I were a technology wizard, I could have adjusted for a better picture. Found the picture to be too dark. The details in shadows were completely eliminated and it got worst in night scenes. Found color control not fixed. Had to adjust color when channel was changed and the process for adjusting the picture is too cumbersome, confusing and lengthy. My assumption is one needs a degree in the process designed for the TV to get it done right and fast, or it could just have been a defective TV.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture, bad Viera app
Reviews.Author: Zo
Reviews.Content: TV has a good picture for a midrange plasma, good functionality of the adjustments, but the Viera app for iphone and android was very spotty.  The Viera app did not like swiping to the TV, only 1 in 20 times did it function.  The TV's video is connected through a great Denon AVR-X2000 receiver, DirecTV, AppleTV, PS3 and a Windows PC.  Switching the sources through the Denon's HDMI connections is very quick, very little lag time.  I like the set.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: First the pros. I love the picture.Now the cons. Only one set of RCA connectors, Everything is USB with HDMI cables on one end and whatever your component needs on the other. Good luck figuring it out. It claims it has internet capabilities when actually all it is is youtube , netflix, Hulu and another movie provider. You CANNOT surf the web on this thing. No swivel or tilt base, Not at all user friendly.We have only had it a couple months and are going to deal with it for a few more before putting it on Craigslist and trying to re-coup a little bit of our money. I'll NEVER buy another one!

Reviews.Title: two stars off for poor codec implimentation
Reviews.Author: Steven G
Reviews.Content: A decent value at about $640. The Netflix / Amazon / Hulu / Youtube streaming works great over the built-in Ethernet connection, and I found about 60 over-the-air stations by plugging in a $9 flat panel antenna. I also could play movies served from a hard drive plugged into my LAN router, but the TV was rather disappointingly limited in the file format types it could handle - rejecting about half my library (no .AVI!). So in the end I had to spring for an $88 Android-based set-top box with a more complete (and upgradeable) set of codecs in order to access the full range of LAN & Internet based services I wanted to use. Which means paying a premium for a set with an internal Internet connection was unnecessary since the Android box outputs to an HDMI. I also expected that a set with a full Internet connection would provide for some means of navigating to additional sites not pre-programmed at the factory. The equivalent size & quality Samsung set without the Internet interface was going for $500.

Reviews.Title: Worst purchase EVER
Reviews.Author: macruadhri
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV just over a year ago. Just after the warrantee expired, the TV refused to power on. Panasonic found the closest repair service to be over 60 miles away from my home ( no, I'm not in the boonies -- southern California not far from Los Angeles ). The repair facility wanted $185 just to drive to my home with no guarantee of repairing it AND no guarantee of when they would arrive. I passed. Panasonic has lost at least one potential customer.

Reviews.Content: Its just a very lackluster  despite positiver review.. sound is a bit weak as well.  Every time I look at it, I just go... eh

Reviews.Title: Great picture muddied by horrible judder
Reviews.Author: Gadget
Reviews.Content: I am on my second one. I wanted this to work. Picture is great. However picture judder is atrocious and makes watching sports or any 1080i video difficult. Also there is an audible snapping sound that has been there on both of my units. It continues even long after tv is turned off. I consider myself a panasonic plasma guy. I have their reference 65" that I paid $2,500 for. That one is hard to beat. This one just isnt up to standard and I am surprised by this. As like the first one I tried, this one will be going back also.

Reviews.Title: Never got it...
Reviews.Author: Staci
Reviews.Content: I wish I could rate this tv, but I never got it... So I will have to rate the experience. I was charged and given a tracking number... And as I watched (what I thought was my purchase) travel towards my address, it stopped a few states away and the status showed it was delivered.  I called the shipping carrier and as it turns out, the seller gave me a made up tracking number, so I was watching someone else's package travel to its destination.  When I contacted the seller, they told me it was a computing mistake and that the would provide the correct tracking number ASAP.  Over a week went by with excuse after excuse until I found out that my tv was never even shipped, and that they did not even have it to sell.My credit card was refunded, but I would never try to purchase an expensive item like this from this particular third party seller ever again.  It was a very stressful experience.

Reviews.Title: just like the old one
Reviews.Author: pamela goldsmith
Reviews.Content: This was a replacement for a previous Panasonic 50", and it is just like the old one, no improvements that I can see

Reviews.Title: Great screen, bad electronics
Reviews.Author: pseudoscience
Reviews.Content: It seems a shame that the screen is so capable, but the supporting electronics seem not up to the task. If all you're watching is antenna television through the RF input, or images streamed over the built-in wifi connection, the picture is great, although there was noise, and it looked better streaming from my Playstation 3. The problem seems to be in the HDMI inputs and the way the picture is translated from, say, my PS3, to the screen, or worst of all, from my computer to the screen.The problem is that the brightness changes, and it seems to change based on how much brightness is being demanded by the input device. As the image should be getting brighter, it instead gets darker, as if a choke were being applied. My primary purpose for this television was as a monitor for my Mac Mini. Whenever I filled the screen with a window with a white background, or other bright colors, the screen would dim to the point that my eyes hurt from straining to see the picture. Pictures on web pages were barely discernable, and text was barely readable.I own a digital copy of The Hobbit on Amazon Prime, and I streamed it through the television's wifi connection. I watched the Rivendell scene with Galadriel and Gandolf standing on the cliff with the sunrise in the background. The wifi connection produces a great picture, and it didn't seem to suffer from the brightness issue, but there were other kinds of noise. I switched over to my Playstation 3 and streamed the same scene via HDMI input and there was absolutely no noise, the picture was beautiful, but the brightness changed dynamically. I then watched the Riddles in the Dark scene, where Bilbo meets Golum for the first time in his cave. This dark scene looked superb. The blacks were perfect, even in the shadows, but at the end of the scene when they run out from under the mountain into daylight, the blacks were suddenly crushed (crushing is when you loose detail in the dark areas and it looks like a clump of dark black).I played Red Dead Redemption, which is a cowboy game that puts you on a horse in the Mexican desert with the sun blasting you during the day. At high noon, when the sun is brightest and the whites are nearly blown out, I loose all detail in the blacks. Then, the game switches to night mode, and the blacks suddenly come alive. The starry sky looks beautiful.I spent an hour talking to the Magnolia guy, and I learned that to get a picture that lives up to my standards, I will have to spend a couple thousand dollars at least. Apparently, what I need is something that not only has a beautiful screen, but circuitry that is strong enough to properly translate the video from the HDMI inputs. I thought $700 would be enough, but it isn't. I almost bought a $2000 Samsung instead, but the whole point of this was to treat myself because I got myself out of debt, but I am not about to get myself right back into debt by buying something beyond my means, so I am going back to my old tv. It is a 32" Dynex (Best Buy brand), and it has served me well for a couple of years. I would rather have this small tv with a perfect picture, than a big plasma that changes brightness. I might buy a larger version of what I have, like a 42" Dynex LCD. I've really been surprised by how great the picture has been on this Dynex 32".

Reviews.Title: Disposable tv no repair parts.
Reviews.Author: Ronald Mcleod
Reviews.Content: I loved my 50" plasma for 3 1/2 years with no problem until 2 months ago Essentially the exact same TV as this newer model....then the power light started blinking in a sequence of seven.  This code means one of the boards has gone out.  Google seven flashes of doom (or death.)  Tried to get it repaired but guess what...Panasonic does not make replacement boards for this TV making it junk. The repair shop tried everything to get one but they just aren't available.  The reason is they figure that by the time the TV fails out of warranty you will want to replace it with the newest thing. Bull I don't need the newest thing I need a TV that will last longer than 3-4 years and have repair parts available for at least 10 years especially for a part that is well known for failure.  It's just a circuit board that costs them next to nothing to make and they can make 300% profit from it.  So aside for a bill to the repair shop .( they were sympathetic and only charged $50.00) I now own a $1200.00 boat anchor after 3 1/2 years of light to moderate use. Good luck.

Reviews.Content: google panasonic 7 blinks, then decide if you want this tv. panasonic is having a lot of issues with the "a" board and the tvs are failing after a year. no warranty has been extended.  but they do work great for the first year so if you replace your tv every year...

Reviews.Title: Poor quality and customer support.
Reviews.Author: Wayne
Reviews.Content: Two years ago I bought a Panasonic Viera TCP55GT30 from Amazon.  Paid $1566.90.It is my second Viera and had a beautiful picture.Last week it refused to start, showing the "Seven Blinking Lights of Death".Look that up in Google. Panasonic first said they would not service it, and offered a "Loyalty Discount" on a new tv.This is a two year old set!Later they called me and said to have an authorized service center evaluate it and they will see if they will pay for part of the repair.I did that and the SU and SC cards are bad.$300.00 just for the parts.  $515.00 total repair cost, plus $95.00 for the evaluation.Also the SC card is on back order.I don't know when I will get my set up and running.I don't know how much I will have to pay.If it is 50% or less and the SC card arrives soon, I will probably have it fixed.It is all very annoying.But I have seen similar complaints about other brands.May end up just replacing it with another brand and hoping for the best.One week later:This is to add additional info on this product.I heard from Panasonic, and I will credit them with being prompt.  It only took them  2 days after they received my paperwork to give me a call with their verdict. Of the $515 it is going to cost me tto fix this TV, they will eat only $175.  Not even half.  So, I am faced with spending $340 more to fix a 2 year old set.I am going to do it, since the alternative is four figures to replace it.But, this is strike two, one more, and it is a new TV for this house.So, the one star remains.  Panasonic should spend more on engineering, and less on advertising.

Reviews.Title: Prepare to locate a service center
Reviews.Author: seth harris
Reviews.Content: I bought this Panasonic Plasma after reading consumer reports just like the rest of you. I purchased in 10/2011. Loud buzzing was intermittent from the get go. Set died with the 14 red light blink code after 9 months. Drug it down to the electronics repair station after opening a case with panasonic. They replaced a board and we were back in business a week later. I am now at month 16, out of warranty, the set has died with seven blinking light code now. They tell me it is a different board this time. It is back at the repair shop as I write this. Panasonic says it may cover part of the repair based on their discretion. I thought I was pretty smart throwing out my old bulky tube tv, meanwhile the tv repair shop has built a new building and stopped leasing. I wonder how many of these disposable flat panel televisions I will buy in my lifetime. I should go down to the trashdump with a shovel and find my old tube television, I bet it still works.
